text: <TITLE_START> Super Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 cup butter<INGR_NEXT> 6 tbsp sugar<INGR_NEXT> 6 tbsp light brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tsp pure vanilla extract<INGR_NEXT> 1 egg<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/8 cup - ap flour<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tsp baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 tsp salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup milk chocolate chips<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 375<INSTR_NEXT> beat butter, both sugars and vanilla until well blended and creamy<INSTR_NEXT> add egg; beat until blended<INSTR_NEXT> in separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt<INSTR_NEXT> gradually add flour mixture to sugar mixture, beating until well blended<INSTR_NEXT> stir in chocolate chips<INSTR_NEXT> refrigerate dough for at least 1 hour<INSTR_NEXT> drop dough by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet<INSTR_NEXT> bake 10-12 minutes or until slightly browned<INSTR_NEXT> cool on cookie sheet for 1-2 minutes, then transfer to wire rack<INSTR_NEXT> **makes 18-24 cookies, depending on size you want<INSTR_NEXT> ** i think this recipe came from a hersheys chocloate chip package<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 375
Beat butter, both sugars and vanilla until well blended and creamy
Add egg; beat until blended
In separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt
Gradually add flour mixture to sugar mixture, beating until well blended
Stir in chocolate chips
Refrigerate dough for at least 1 hour
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet
Bake 10-12 minutes or until slightly browned
Cool on cookie sheet for 1-2 minutes, then transfer to wire rack
**makes 18-24 cookies, depending on size you want
** i think this recipe came from a hersheys chocloate chip package

text: <TITLE_START> Baked Beans<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb dried navy beans<INGR_NEXT> 1 piece salt pork<INGR_NEXT> 4 1/2 cups water<INGR_NEXT> 1 large onion, finely chopped<INGR_NEXT> 2 chopped garlic cloves<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup grade b maple syrup<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon dry english mustard<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<INGR_END><INSTR_START> pick over and rinse 1 lb dried navy beans .<INSTR_NEXT> soak in cold water to cover by 2 inches at least 8 hours.<INSTR_NEXT> alternatively, quick-soak beans .<INSTR_NEXT> put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350f.<INSTR_NEXT> rinse and pat dry 1 piece salt pork , then cut into 3 pieces.<INSTR_NEXT> put beans and pork in an ovenproof 3-quart heavy pot with a lid.<INSTR_NEXT> add 4 1/2 cups water, 1 large onion , 2 chopped garlic cloves, 1/2 cup grade b maple syrup, 1 tablespoon dry english mustard , and 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper and stir to combine.<INSTR_NEXT> cover pot and bake until beans are just tender, 3 to 4 hours.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce oven temperature to 325f.<INSTR_NEXT> bake beans, stirring occasionally, until most of liquid is absorbed but beans are still saucy, 1 to 1 1/2 hours more.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from oven.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in 1 tablespoon cider vinegar and 1 teaspoon salt or more to taste.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Pick over and rinse 1 lb dried navy beans .
Soak in cold water to cover by 2 inches at least 8 hours.
Alternatively, quick-soak beans .
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350f.
Rinse and pat dry 1 piece salt pork , then cut into 3 pieces.
Put beans and pork in an ovenproof 3-quart heavy pot with a lid.
Add 4 1/2 cups water, 1 large onion , 2 chopped garlic cloves, 1/2 cup grade b maple syrup, 1 tablespoon dry english mustard , and 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper and stir to combine.
Cover pot and bake until beans are just tender, 3 to 4 hours.
Reduce oven temperature to 325f.
Bake beans, stirring occasionally, until most of liquid is absorbed but beans are still saucy, 1 to 1 1/2 hours more.
Remove from oven.
Stir in 1 tablespoon cider vinegar and 1 teaspoon salt or more to taste.
output: Pick over and rinse 1 lb dried navy beans . Soak in cold water to cover by 2 inches at least 8 hours. Alternatively, quick-soak beans . Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350f. Rinse and pat dry 1 piece salt pork , then cut into 3 pieces. Put beans and pork in an ovenproof 3-quart heavy pot with a lid. Add 4 1/2 cups water, 1 large onion , 2 chopped garlic cloves, 1/2 cup grade b maple syrup, 1 tablespoon dry english mustard , and 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper and stir to combine. Cover pot and bake until beans are just tender, 3 to 4 hours. Reduce oven temperature to 325f. Bake beans, stirring occasionally, until most of liquid is absorbed but beans are still saucy, 1 to 1 1/2 hours more. Remove from oven. Stir in 1 tablespoon cider vinegar and 1 teaspoon salt or more to taste.
output_sentences_v1: Remove from oven.
Soak in cold water to cover by 2 inches at least 8 hours.
Bake beans, stirring occasionally, until most of liquid is absorbed but beans are still saucy, 1 to 1 1/2 hours more.

Pick over and rinse 1 lb dried navy beans .

text: <TITLE_START> Thanksgiving Asparagus Casserole<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup shredded sharp new york cheddar cheese<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 pinch ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 2 cans asparagus spears, drained<INGR_NEXT> 1 package blanched slivered almonds<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat an oven to 350 degrees f .<INSTR_NEXT> grease a 8x8 inch baking dish.<INSTR_NEXT> melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat.<INSTR_NEXT> whisk in the flour, and stir until the mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> gradually whisk the milk into the flour mixture, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and stir until the mixture is thick and smooth, 10 to 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from the heat, and whisk in the cheddar cheese until melted.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> line the prepared baking dish with half of the asparagus spears.<INSTR_NEXT> pour in half of the cheese sauce, top with the remaining asparagus spears, then pour on the remaining sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle with the slivered almonds.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in the preheated oven until the asparagus is hot and the sauce is golden brown on top, about 20 minutes.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 cup shredded sharp new york cheddar cheese
output_sentences: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees f .
Grease a 8x8 inch baking dish.
Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat.
Whisk in the flour, and stir until the mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Gradually whisk the milk into the flour mixture, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Cook and stir until the mixture is thick and smooth, 10 to 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat, and whisk in the cheddar cheese until melted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Line the prepared baking dish with half of the asparagus spears.
Pour in half of the cheese sauce, top with the remaining asparagus spears, then pour on the remaining sauce.
Sprinkle with the slivered almonds.
Bake in the preheated oven until the asparagus is hot and the sauce is golden brown on top, about 20 minutes.
output: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees f . Grease a 8x8 inch baking dish. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk in the flour, and stir until the mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Gradually whisk the milk into the flour mixture, and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture is thick and smooth, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the heat, and whisk in the cheddar cheese until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Line the prepared baking dish with half of the asparagus spears. Pour in half of the cheese sauce, top with the remaining asparagus spears, then pour on the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with the slivered almonds. Bake in the preheated oven until the asparagus is hot and the sauce is golden brown on top, about 20 minutes.

text: <TITLE_START> Creamy Non Dairy Romaine Salad<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 medium head romaine lettuce, outer leaves discarded<INGR_NEXT> 1 bunch young dandelion greens, if available<INGR_NEXT> 1 medium tomatoes, cut into eighths<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons chopped fresh basil<INGR_NEXT> 3 medium garlic cloves, pressed<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon prepared dijon mustard<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon honey<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon cracked black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup sunflower seeds<INGR_NEXT> 4 ounces silken tofu<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons water, if needed to thin dressing<INGR_END><INSTR_START> blend all dressing ingredients in blender adding oil a little at a time at the end.<INSTR_NEXT> make sure you blend this dressing well so the sunflower seeds are ground.<INSTR_NEXT> stop your blender and test for smoothness.<INSTR_NEXT> when the seeds are ground well they will make your dressing nice and creamy.<INSTR_NEXT> chop, rinse, and dry romaine and dandelion greens.<INSTR_NEXT> if you have a salad spinner it is best.<INSTR_NEXT> if not, pat rinsed greens with paper towels so dressing doesnt get diluted.<INSTR_NEXT> toss greens with tomato and desired amount of dressing.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 medium head romaine lettuce, outer leaves discarded
1 bunch young dandelion greens, if available
2 tablespoons water, if needed to thin dressing
output_sentences: Blend all dressing ingredients in blender adding oil a little at a time at the end.
Make sure you blend this dressing well so the sunflower seeds are ground.
Stop your blender and test for smoothness.
When the seeds are ground well they will make your dressing nice and creamy.
Chop, rinse, and dry romaine and dandelion greens.
If you have a salad spinner it is best.
If not, pat rinsed greens with paper towels so dressing doesnt get diluted.
Toss greens with tomato and desired amount of dressing.
output: Blend all dressing ingredients in blender adding oil a little at a time at the end. Make sure you blend this dressing well so the sunflower seeds are ground. Stop your blender and test for smoothness. When the seeds are ground well they will make your dressing nice and creamy. Chop, rinse, and dry romaine and dandelion greens. If you have a salad spinner it is best. If not, pat rinsed greens with paper towels so dressing doesnt get diluted. Toss greens with tomato and desired amount of dressing.

text: <TITLE_START> Glazed Ham with Cider Raisin Sauce<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 12 to 14-pound bone-in ready-to-eat smoked ham, allowed to stand at room temperature for 2 hours<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups cider<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup packed light brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons prepared mustard<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 cups fresh bread crumbs<INGR_NEXT> pinch of ground cloves<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup raisins<INGR_NEXT> freshly grated nutmeg, to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon cider<INGR_NEXT> salt and freshly ground pepper<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 325 degrees f.<INSTR_NEXT> insert meat thermometer into center of ham without touching bone.<INSTR_NEXT> place ham on rack in roasting pan and brush all over with cider.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer to oven and roast, basting every 20 minutes with cider, for a total cooking time of 12 to 15 minutes per pound or until the meat thermometer registers 140 degrees f.<INSTR_NEXT> in a bowl combine brown sugar, mustard, bread crumbs and ground cloves.<INSTR_NEXT> about a 1/2 hour before the ham is done firmly pat the sugar mixture over the top of the ham and continue to roast.<INSTR_NEXT> when ham is done, transfer to a carving board and allow to rest for 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer roasting pan to stove top, heat over moderately high heat and deglaze with the remaining cider.<INSTR_NEXT> with a wooden spoon scrape up any browned bits from bottom of roasting pan.<INSTR_NEXT> add the raisins and nutmeg and simmer for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> whisk in cornstarch mixture, return to a simmer and stir until thickened.<INSTR_NEXT> adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary.<INSTR_NEXT> carve ham and serve.<INSTR_END>
input: Glazed Ham with Cider Raisin Sauce
ingredients: 1 12 to 14-pound bone-in ready-to-eat smoked ham, allowed to stand at room temperature for 2 hours
1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon cider
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 325 degrees f.
Insert meat thermometer into center of ham without touching bone.
Place ham on rack in roasting pan and brush all over with cider.
Transfer to oven and roast, basting every 20 minutes with cider, for a total cooking time of 12 to 15 minutes per pound or until the meat thermometer registers 140 degrees f.
In a bowl combine brown sugar, mustard, bread crumbs and ground cloves.
About a 1/2 hour before the ham is done firmly pat the sugar mixture over the top of the ham and continue to roast.
When ham is done, transfer to a carving board and allow to rest for 15 minutes.
Transfer roasting pan to stove top, heat over moderately high heat and deglaze with the remaining cider.
With a wooden spoon scrape up any browned bits from bottom of roasting pan.
Add the raisins and nutmeg and simmer for 5 minutes.
Whisk in cornstarch mixture, return to a simmer and stir until thickened.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary.
Carve ham and serve.

In a bowl combine brown sugar, mustard, bread crumbs and ground cloves. About a 1/2 hour before the ham is done firmly pat the sugar mixture over the top of the ham and continue to roast. With a wooden spoon scrape up any browned bits from bottom of roasting pan. Add the raisins and nutmeg and simmer for 5 minutes. Whisk in cornstarch mixture, return to a simmer and stir until thickened. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary. Carve ham and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Chocolate Chip Brownie Bars<TITLE_END><INGR_START> nonstick cooking spray<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup butter, softened<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 cups firmly packed brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 4 large eggs<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup semisweet chocolate morsels<INGR_NEXT> one 6.5-ounce box brownie mix<INGR_NEXT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. line a 13-by-9-inch baking pan with heavy-duty aluminum foil with a 2-inch overhang.<INSTR_NEXT> spray with nonstick cooking spray.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl, beat the butter and brown sugar at medium-high speed with a mixer until fluffy.<INSTR_NEXT> add 2 eggs, beating until well blended.<INSTR_NEXT> in a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt.<INSTR_NEXT> gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, beating until the mixture forms a soft dough.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the chocolate morsels.<INSTR_NEXT> in another large bowl, combine the brownie mix, oil, 1/4 cup water and remaining 2 eggs, beating until well blended.<INSTR_NEXT> spread the the cookie dough in prepared pan.<INSTR_NEXT> pour the brownie mixture over the dough.<INSTR_NEXT> using a knife, swirl the mixtures together.<INSTR_NEXT> bake until the edges start to pull away from sides of the pan, 40 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> let cool in the pan for 1 hour.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and refrigerate for 4 hours.<INSTR_NEXT> cut into bars.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. line a 13-by-9-inch baking pan with heavy-duty aluminum foil with a 2-inch overhang.
Spray with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large bowl, beat the butter and brown sugar at medium-high speed with a mixer until fluffy.
Add 2 eggs, beating until well blended.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, beating until the mixture forms a soft dough.
Stir in the chocolate morsels.
In another large bowl, combine the brownie mix, oil, 1/4 cup water and remaining 2 eggs, beating until well blended.
Spread the the cookie dough in prepared pan.
Pour the brownie mixture over the dough.
Using a knife, swirl the mixtures together.
Bake until the edges start to pull away from sides of the pan, 40 minutes.
Let cool in the pan for 1 hour.
Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Cut into bars.
output: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. line a 13-by-9-inch baking pan with heavy-duty aluminum foil with a 2-inch overhang. Spray with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, beat the butter and brown sugar at medium-high speed with a mixer until fluffy. Add 2 eggs, beating until well blended. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, beating until the mixture forms a soft dough. Stir in the chocolate morsels. In another large bowl, combine the brownie mix, oil, 1/4 cup water and remaining 2 eggs, beating until well blended. Spread the the cookie dough in prepared pan. Pour the brownie mixture over the dough. Using a knife, swirl the mixtures together. Bake until the edges start to pull away from sides of the pan, 40 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 1 hour. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours. Cut into bars.

Spread the the cookie dough in prepared pan.
Let cool in the pan for 1 hour.
Cut into bars.

Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours.

text: <TITLE_START> Jumbo Pumpkin Muffins Recipe CindyJ<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 3/4 cups sifted unbleached all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoon double-acting baking powder<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 cups sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 2 large eggs, lightly beaten<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup canned pumpkin puree<INGR_NEXT> 1/3 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup yellow raisins<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350 degrees.<INSTR_NEXT> butter and flour a 6-cup jumbo muffin pan.<INSTR_NEXT> into a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, salt, ginger, cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon.<INSTR_NEXT> in another bowl beat together the eggs, oil, pumpkin puree and water.<INSTR_NEXT> add to the flour mixture and beat until the batter is combined.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the raisins .<INSTR_NEXT> divide batter into the prepared muffin cups.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in center of preheated oven for 55 minutes, or until a tester comes out clean.<INSTR_NEXT> let the muffins cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> turn muffins out onto a rack and let them cool completely.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Butter and flour a 6-cup jumbo muffin pan.
Into a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, salt, ginger, cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon.
In another bowl beat together the eggs, oil, pumpkin puree and water.
Add to the flour mixture and beat until the batter is combined.
Stir in the raisins .
Divide batter into the prepared muffin cups.
Bake in center of preheated oven for 55 minutes, or until a tester comes out clean.
Let the muffins cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes.
Turn muffins out onto a rack and let them cool completely.
output: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter and flour a 6-cup jumbo muffin pan. Into a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, salt, ginger, cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon. In another bowl beat together the eggs, oil, pumpkin puree and water. Add to the flour mixture and beat until the batter is combined. Stir in the raisins . Divide batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake in center of preheated oven for 55 minutes, or until a tester comes out clean. Let the muffins cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes. Turn muffins out onto a rack and let them cool completely.

text: <TITLE_START> Roasted Chicken Provencal<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 chicken legs or 8 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons kosher salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1/2-3/4 cup all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons herbes de provence<INGR_NEXT> 1 lemon, quartered<INGR_NEXT> 8-10 cloves garlic, peeled<INGR_NEXT> 4-6 medium-size shallots, peeled and halved<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup dry vermouth<INGR_NEXT> 4 sprigs of thyme, for serving<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 400.<INSTR_NEXT> season the chicken with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> put the flour in a shallow pan, and lightly dredge the chicken in it, shaking the pieces to remove excess flour.<INSTR_NEXT> swirl the oil in a large roasting pan, and place the floured chicken in it.<INSTR_NEXT> season the chicken with the herbes de provence.<INSTR_NEXT> arrange the lemons, garlic cloves and shallots around the chicken, and then add the vermouth to the pan.<INSTR_NEXT> put the pan in the oven, and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, then baste it with the pan juices.<INSTR_NEXT> continue roasting for an additional 25 to 30 minutes, or until the chicken is very crisp and the meat cooked through.<INSTR_NEXT> serve in the pan or on a warmed platter, garnished with the thyme.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 4 chicken legs or 8 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 400.
Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
Put the flour in a shallow pan, and lightly dredge the chicken in it, shaking the pieces to remove excess flour.
Swirl the oil in a large roasting pan, and place the floured chicken in it.
Season the chicken with the herbes de provence.
Arrange the lemons, garlic cloves and shallots around the chicken, and then add the vermouth to the pan.
Put the pan in the oven, and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, then baste it with the pan juices.
Continue roasting for an additional 25 to 30 minutes, or until the chicken is very crisp and the meat cooked through.
Serve in the pan or on a warmed platter, garnished with the thyme.
output: Preheat oven to 400. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Put the flour in a shallow pan, and lightly dredge the chicken in it, shaking the pieces to remove excess flour. Swirl the oil in a large roasting pan, and place the floured chicken in it. Season the chicken with the herbes de provence. Arrange the lemons, garlic cloves and shallots around the chicken, and then add the vermouth to the pan. Put the pan in the oven, and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, then baste it with the pan juices. Continue roasting for an additional 25 to 30 minutes, or until the chicken is very crisp and the meat cooked through. Serve in the pan or on a warmed platter, garnished with the thyme.

text: <TITLE_START> Eggs Poached in a Tomato Sauce With Bacon & Mushrooms<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 tablespoon olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup onions, diced<INGR_NEXT> 4 cloves garlic, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups chicken stock<INGR_NEXT> 1 can 14 oz can, diced tomatoes, no salt added<INGR_NEXT> 1 can diced green chilies<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup button mushrooms, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon each: smoked paprika, garlic powder, oregano, pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoons garlic salt<INGR_NEXT> 4 strips bacon, uncured<INGR_NEXT> 4 whole eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups parmesan cheese, shredded<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups green onions, diced<INGR_NEXT> crusty bread, for dipping<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a cast iron skillet over medium heat add oil, onions, and garlic.<INSTR_NEXT> let the mixture bloom for 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add in chicken stock, diced tomatoes, green chilies, mushrooms, and spices .<INSTR_NEXT> let mixture come to a simmer, then turn heat to medium-low and cover the skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> let it heat for about 20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> meanwhile broil or fry the bacon.<INSTR_NEXT> i like to line a rimmed baking sheet with foil, place a cooling rack over the foil, and lay bacon down on the rack.<INSTR_NEXT> broil bacon for 5 minutes per side, until crispy and browned.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from oven, blot bacon with paper towels, and chop into chunks.<INSTR_NEXT> set aside to keep warm.<INSTR_NEXT> taste tomato mixture and season with additional salt, pepper or spices if needed.<INSTR_NEXT> make a little well in the mixture in 4 spots, crack an egg into each well, and cover the skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> cook over medium heat about 10 minutes or until whites are no longer runny and eggs reach your desired done-ness.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish with parmesan cheese, bacon and green onions, and serve with crusty bread.<INSTR_END>
input: Eggs Poached in a Tomato Sauce With Bacon & Mushrooms
ingredients: 1 can 14 oz can, diced tomatoes, no salt added
1 teaspoon each: smoked paprika, garlic powder, oregano, pepper
output_sentences: In a cast iron skillet over medium heat add oil, onions, and garlic.
Let the mixture bloom for 2 minutes.
Add in chicken stock, diced tomatoes, green chilies, mushrooms, and spices .
Let mixture come to a simmer, then turn heat to medium-low and cover the skillet.
Let it heat for about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile broil or fry the bacon.
I like to line a rimmed baking sheet with foil, place a cooling rack over the foil, and lay bacon down on the rack.
Broil bacon for 5 minutes per side, until crispy and browned.
Remove from oven, blot bacon with paper towels, and chop into chunks.
Set aside to keep warm.
Taste tomato mixture and season with additional salt, pepper or spices if needed.
Make a little well in the mixture in 4 spots, crack an egg into each well, and cover the skillet.
Cook over medium heat about 10 minutes or until whites are no longer runny and eggs reach your desired done-ness.
Garnish with parmesan cheese, bacon and green onions, and serve with crusty bread.
output: In a cast iron skillet over medium heat add oil, onions, and garlic. Let the mixture bloom for 2 minutes. Add in chicken stock, diced tomatoes, green chilies, mushrooms, and spices . Let mixture come to a simmer, then turn heat to medium-low and cover the skillet. Let it heat for about 20 minutes. Meanwhile broil or fry the bacon. I like to line a rimmed baking sheet with foil, place a cooling rack over the foil, and lay bacon down on the rack. Broil bacon for 5 minutes per side, until crispy and browned. Remove from oven, blot bacon with paper towels, and chop into chunks. Set aside to keep warm. Taste tomato mixture and season with additional salt, pepper or spices if needed. Make a little well in the mixture in 4 spots, crack an egg into each well, and cover the skillet. Cook over medium heat about 10 minutes or until whites are no longer runny and eggs reach your desired done-ness. Garnish with parmesan cheese, bacon and green onions, and serve with crusty bread.

text: <TITLE_START> Maryland Crab Cakes<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 5 lbs blue claw lumb crabmeat, chopped medium fine<INGR_NEXT> 10 oz red pepper, chopped medium fine<INGR_NEXT> 10 oz spanish onion, chopped medium fine<INGR_NEXT> 1 qt heavy cream<INGR_NEXT> 3 egg whites<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup crushed red pepper<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups chopped parsley<INGR_NEXT> 10 oz fine breadcrumbs<INGR_NEXT> 2 oz mixed salt, pepper, oregano, thyme, and paprika<INGR_END><INSTR_START> saute the onions and red pepper in olive oil only until slightly soft, then drain.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce 1 quart of heavy cream by 1/4.<INSTR_NEXT> beat egg whites till stiff and add to the cream.<INSTR_NEXT> add chili powder and crushed red pepper to cream.<INSTR_NEXT> add cream mixture to crabmeat and mix well by hand.<INSTR_NEXT> add sauteed onions and peppers, parsley, breadcrumbs, and mixed spices, and mix again by hand.<INSTR_NEXT> form into cakes 3 1/2 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick.<INSTR_NEXT> put on a buttered pad and broil about 1 minute on each side, or until slightly browned.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 5 lbs blue claw lumb crabmeat, chopped medium fine
10 oz red pepper, chopped medium fine
10 oz spanish onion, chopped medium fine
2 oz mixed salt, pepper, oregano, thyme, and paprika
output_sentences: Saute the onions and red pepper in olive oil only until slightly soft, then drain.
Reduce 1 quart of heavy cream by 1/4.
Beat egg whites till stiff and add to the cream.
Add chili powder and crushed red pepper to cream.
Add cream mixture to crabmeat and mix well by hand.
Add sauteed onions and peppers, parsley, breadcrumbs, and mixed spices, and mix again by hand.
Form into cakes 3 1/2 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick.
Put on a buttered pad and broil about 1 minute on each side, or until slightly browned.
output: Saute the onions and red pepper in olive oil only until slightly soft, then drain. Reduce 1 quart of heavy cream by 1/4. Beat egg whites till stiff and add to the cream. Add chili powder and crushed red pepper to cream. Add cream mixture to crabmeat and mix well by hand. Add sauteed onions and peppers, parsley, breadcrumbs, and mixed spices, and mix again by hand. Form into cakes 3 1/2 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick. Put on a buttered pad and broil about 1 minute on each side, or until slightly browned.

text: <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter, Apple and Bacon Quesadilla<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 tablespoon butter<INGR_NEXT> 2 whole whole-wheat tortillas<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons peanut butter<INGR_NEXT> 6 slices bacon<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 whole medium apple, sliced<INGR_END><INSTR_START> spread butter on each tortilla.<INSTR_NEXT> set one, buttered side down, in the bottom of a skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> set the other aside.<INSTR_NEXT> spread the tortilla in the skillet with peanut butter.<INSTR_NEXT> lay bacon pieces atop peanut butter, followed by apple slices.<INSTR_NEXT> top with the second tortilla, butter side up.<INSTR_NEXT> cook over medium heat, flipping when the bottom tortilla begins to brown.<INSTR_NEXT> also, when you flip, if the bacon and apples fall out, dont stress.<INSTR_NEXT> just rearrange and carry on like nothing happened.<INSTR_END>
input: Peanut Butter, Apple and Bacon Quesadilla
output_sentences: Spread butter on each tortilla.
Set one, buttered side down, in the bottom of a skillet.
Set the other aside.
Spread the tortilla in the skillet with peanut butter.
Lay bacon pieces atop peanut butter, followed by apple slices.
Top with the second tortilla, butter side up.
Cook over medium heat, flipping when the bottom tortilla begins to brown.
Also, when you flip, if the bacon and apples fall out, dont stress.
Just rearrange and carry on like nothing happened.
output: Spread butter on each tortilla. Set one, buttered side down, in the bottom of a skillet. Set the other aside. Spread the tortilla in the skillet with peanut butter. Lay bacon pieces atop peanut butter, followed by apple slices. Top with the second tortilla, butter side up. Cook over medium heat, flipping when the bottom tortilla begins to brown. Also, when you flip, if the bacon and apples fall out, dont stress. Just rearrange and carry on like nothing happened.

text: <TITLE_START> Grilled Moroccan Lamb Sausage<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 13 pounds lean lamb, ground with 2/3 pound lamb, pork or beef fat<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons water<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons paprika<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground coriander<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/4 teaspoons cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper or to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/4 teaspoons salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 2 feet hog casing<INGR_NEXT> 1 large green pepper, cored and cut into 8 pieces<INGR_NEXT> 2 medium-size onions, peeled and quartered<INGR_END><INSTR_START> combine all ingredients except the olive oil and the three optional items in a large bowl and mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> if making sausages, use the sausage attachment on a heavy-duty mixer, stuff the casing with the mixture and twist and tie to make eight 4-inch links.<INSTR_NEXT> or shape into eight 3-inch-long lozenges, slightly fatter in the middle, formed around metal skewers or into 8 patties.<INSTR_NEXT> preheat grill or broiler.<INSTR_NEXT> if the sausages are in casings, prick with a fork 2 to 3 times and brush with oil.<INSTR_NEXT> grill or broil 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through.<INSTR_NEXT> for lozenges, brush with oil and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side.<INSTR_NEXT> for patties, brush with oil and grill 4 to 5 minutes on each side or saute over high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> if desired, sausages may be threaded on four skewers alternately with green pepper pieces and onion quarters before grilling.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 13 pounds lean lamb, ground with 2/3 pound lamb, pork or beef fat
3/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper or to taste
1 large green pepper, cored and cut into 8 pieces
output_sentences: Combine all ingredients except the olive oil and the three optional items in a large bowl and mix well.
If making sausages, use the sausage attachment on a heavy-duty mixer, stuff the casing with the mixture and twist and tie to make eight 4-inch links.
Or shape into eight 3-inch-long lozenges, slightly fatter in the middle, formed around metal skewers or into 8 patties.
Preheat grill or broiler.
If the sausages are in casings, prick with a fork 2 to 3 times and brush with oil.
Grill or broil 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through.
For lozenges, brush with oil and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
For patties, brush with oil and grill 4 to 5 minutes on each side or saute over high heat.
If desired, sausages may be threaded on four skewers alternately with green pepper pieces and onion quarters before grilling.
output: Combine all ingredients except the olive oil and the three optional items in a large bowl and mix well. If making sausages, use the sausage attachment on a heavy-duty mixer, stuff the casing with the mixture and twist and tie to make eight 4-inch links. Or shape into eight 3-inch-long lozenges, slightly fatter in the middle, formed around metal skewers or into 8 patties. Preheat grill or broiler. If the sausages are in casings, prick with a fork 2 to 3 times and brush with oil. Grill or broil 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. For lozenges, brush with oil and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side. For patties, brush with oil and grill 4 to 5 minutes on each side or saute over high heat. If desired, sausages may be threaded on four skewers alternately with green pepper pieces and onion quarters before grilling.
output_sentences_v1: For lozenges, brush with oil and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
If desired, sausages may be threaded on four skewers alternately with green pepper pieces and onion quarters before grilling.
For patties, brush with oil and grill 4 to 5 minutes on each side or saute over high heat.
Or shape into eight 3-inch-long lozenges, slightly fatter in the middle, formed around metal skewers or into 8 patties.
Preheat grill or broiler.
If making sausages, use the sausage attachment on a heavy-duty mixer, stuff the casing with the mixture and twist and tie to make eight 4-inch links.
Grill or broil 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through.

text: <TITLE_START> Pineapple upside ' cake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 cup butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup lightly packed brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 can 20 oz sliced pineapples<INGR_NEXT> 1 maraschino cherries<INGR_NEXT> 1 box dunkin hines pineapple supreme cake mix<INGR_NEXT> 3 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 12 in. skillet<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350a place 12 in skillet on med - high heat<INSTR_NEXT> place stick of butter in skillet until completely melted<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add brown sugar until completely dissolved and spread evenly.<INSTR_NEXT> arrange pineapple and cherries anyway you want on top of syrup.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl mix cake mix, water, eggs and vegetable oil.<INSTR_NEXT> pour cake mix in skillet on top of pineapple and cherries.<INSTR_NEXT> place skillet in oven for 30 minutes or until knife comes out clean!<INSTR_NEXT> let sit until it is completely cooled.<INSTR_NEXT> for about 1 hour.<INSTR_NEXT> place large cake plate on top of skillet upside ' and turn skillet over.<INSTR_NEXT> you should have a perfect pineapple upside '!<INSTR_END>

Add brown sugar until completely dissolved and spread evenly.

Place large cake plate on top of skillet upside ' and turn skillet over.

text: <TITLE_START> Roasted Chicken<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 whole chicken<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons coarse salt<INGR_NEXT> 2 -3 tablespoons melted butter<INGR_END><INSTR_START> position a rack in the center of the oven.<INSTR_NEXT> preheat the oven to 400f lightly oil a shallow roasting pan or baking sheet.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the neck and giblets from, then rinse at pat dry 1 whole chicken.<INSTR_NEXT> generously rub the body and neck cavities and sprinkle the skin with salt.<INSTR_NEXT> arrange the chicken breast side up in the pan.<INSTR_NEXT> brush the breast and legs with melted butter.<INSTR_NEXT> put the chicken in the oven and roast.<INSTR_NEXT> if you prize moist breast meat, consider the chicken done when the thickest part of the thigh exudes clear juices when pricked deeply with a fork and registers 170to 175f on an instant-read meat thermometer.<INSTR_NEXT> if you like the dark meat falling off the bone and are willing to risk a dry breast, roast until the thigh registers 180f<INSTR_NEXT> the total roasting time for a 4-pound bird will be 55 to 65 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> for larger birds, figure 1 hour for the first 4 pounds, plus about 8 minutes for each additional pound.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the chicken to a platter and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> carve and serve.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Position a rack in the center of the oven.
Preheat the oven to 400f lightly oil a shallow roasting pan or baking sheet.
Remove the neck and giblets from, then rinse at pat dry 1 whole chicken.
Generously rub the body and neck cavities and sprinkle the skin with salt.
Arrange the chicken breast side up in the pan.
Brush the breast and legs with melted butter.
Put the chicken in the oven and roast.

If you prize moist breast meat, consider the chicken done when the thickest part of the thigh exudes clear juices when pricked deeply with a fork and registers 170to 175f on an instant-read meat thermometer.
If you like the dark meat falling off the bone and are willing to risk a dry breast, roast until the thigh registers 180f
The total roasting time for a 4-pound bird will be 55 to 65 minutes.
For larger birds, figure 1 hour for the first 4 pounds, plus about 8 minutes for each additional pound.
Remove the chicken to a platter and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.
Carve and serve.
output: Position a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400f lightly oil a shallow roasting pan or baking sheet. Remove the neck and giblets from, then rinse at pat dry 1 whole chicken. Generously rub the body and neck cavities and sprinkle the skin with salt. Arrange the chicken breast side up in the pan. Brush the breast and legs with melted butter. Put the chicken in the oven and roast. If you prize moist breast meat, consider the chicken done when the thickest part of the thigh exudes clear juices when pricked deeply with a fork and registers 170to 175f on an instant-read meat thermometer. If you like the dark meat falling off the bone and are willing to risk a dry breast, roast until the thigh registers 180f The total roasting time for a 4-pound bird will be 55 to 65 minutes. For larger birds, figure 1 hour for the first 4 pounds, plus about 8 minutes for each additional pound. Remove the chicken to a platter and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes. Carve and serve.

For larger birds, figure 1 hour for the first 4 pounds, plus about 8 minutes for each additional pound.
Carve and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Butterfly Cakes with Nutty Choc Topping<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 125g butter, softened<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 cup caster sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons vanilla<INGR_NEXT> 2 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 2/3 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups self-raising flour<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup kraft* peanut spread chocolate flavour* spread<INGR_END><INSTR_START> beat butter and sugar until pale and fluffly.<INSTR_NEXT> beat in vanilla and eggs, one at a time.<INSTR_NEXT> gently fold in milk and flour, until well combined.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon batter into 24 patty pans and bake at 180 degrees c for 12-15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> allow to cool.<INSTR_NEXT> cut out a circle from the top of each cake and cut in half to make butterfly wings.<INSTR_NEXT> top each cake with a teaspoon of peanut spread, then position the wings on top.<INSTR_NEXT> dust with icing sugar and serve.<INSTR_END>
input: Butterfly Cakes with Nutty Choc Topping
ingredients: 1/2 cup kraft* peanut spread chocolate flavour* spread
output_sentences: Beat butter and sugar until pale and fluffly.
Beat in vanilla and eggs, one at a time.
Gently fold in milk and flour, until well combined.
Spoon batter into 24 patty pans and bake at 180 degrees c for 12-15 minutes.
Allow to cool.
Cut out a circle from the top of each cake and cut in half to make butterfly wings.
Top each cake with a teaspoon of peanut spread, then position the wings on top.
Dust with icing sugar and serve.
output: Beat butter and sugar until pale and fluffly. Beat in vanilla and eggs, one at a time. Gently fold in milk and flour, until well combined. Spoon batter into 24 patty pans and bake at 180 degrees c for 12-15 minutes. Allow to cool. Cut out a circle from the top of each cake and cut in half to make butterfly wings. Top each cake with a teaspoon of peanut spread, then position the wings on top. Dust with icing sugar and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> World's Best Sloppy Joes<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 12 lbs hamburger<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup onion<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup ketchup<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon barbecue sauce<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon curry powder<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon chili powder<INGR_NEXT> 2 -3 bay leaves<INGR_END><INSTR_START> cook hamburger with onion and salt and pepper to taste.<INSTR_NEXT> add spices, leaving bay leaves whole, but folding them in gently.<INSTR_NEXT> put lid on and reduce heat, simmer for 15-20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add a touch of water if you like your mix a little looser.<INSTR_NEXT> serve on buns with fresh onion and tomatoes, dill pickle if you like.<INSTR_END>

Serve on buns with fresh onion and tomatoes, dill pickle if you like.

text: <TITLE_START> Fresh Asparagus With Lemon-Herb Sauce<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 cups chicken broth<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 lbs thin asparagus spears, ends trimmed<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons olive oil, divided<INGR_NEXT> 3 green onions, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup minced shallot<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon minced garlic<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons dijon mustard<INGR_NEXT> 1 -2 tablespoon fresh lemon juice<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon dried thyme<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon grated lemon peel<INGR_NEXT> salt<INGR_NEXT> lemon pepper<INGR_NEXT> chopped green onion, for sprinkling<INGR_END><INSTR_START> bring the chicken broth to a boil in a large pot.<INSTR_NEXT> add in the asparagus; cook until just crisp-tender .<INSTR_NEXT> uning large tongs remove the asparagus to a bowl of ice water .<INSTR_NEXT> drain the asparagus and pat very dry with paper towels.<INSTR_NEXT> heat 3 tablespoons oil in a skillet over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add in the chopped green onions, shallots and sugar; saute until the onions and shallots are tender .<INSTR_NEXT> add in garlic; saute 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add in the reserved 1 cup broth, 1 tablespoons oil, dijon mustard, lemon juice, thyme and lemon peel; simmer until slightly thickened and the liquid is reduced to about 1-1/4 cups .<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> cool to room temperature.<INSTR_NEXT> arrange the asparagus on a platter.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon the prepared lemon sauce over, then sprinkle with more chopped green onions.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 12 lbs thin asparagus spears, ends trimmed
output_sentences: Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a large pot.
Add in the asparagus; cook until just crisp-tender .
Uning large tongs remove the asparagus to a bowl of ice water .
Drain the asparagus and pat very dry with paper towels.
Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add in the chopped green onions, shallots and sugar; saute until the onions and shallots are tender .
Add in garlic; saute 2 minutes.
Add in the reserved 1 cup broth, 1 tablespoons oil, dijon mustard, lemon juice, thyme and lemon peel; simmer until slightly thickened and the liquid is reduced to about 1-1/4 cups .
Season with salt and pepper.
Cool to room temperature.
Arrange the asparagus on a platter.
Spoon the prepared lemon sauce over, then sprinkle with more chopped green onions.

text: <TITLE_START> Easy Taco Casserole<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb ground beef<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup salsa<INGR_NEXT> 1 packet taco seasoning<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup salad dressing<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups crushed nacho cheese flavored tortilla chips<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups shredded colby-monterey jack cheese<INGR_NEXT> 1 medium tomatoes, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups shredded lettuce<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350f.<INSTR_NEXT> brown ground beef; drain.<INSTR_NEXT> mix ground beef with salsa, taco seasoning, and salad dressing.<INSTR_NEXT> in a 2-quart baking dish, layer half of the meat mixture, 1 cup of cheese and 1 cup of the tortilla chips.<INSTR_NEXT> repeat the layers.<INSTR_NEXT> bake, covered, for 30-40 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.<INSTR_NEXT> take off cover the last 10 minutes of baking.<INSTR_NEXT> top with lettuce and tomato before serving.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 2 cups crushed nacho cheese flavored tortilla chips
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350f.
Brown ground beef; drain.
Mix ground beef with salsa, taco seasoning, and salad dressing.
In a 2-quart baking dish, layer half of the meat mixture, 1 cup of cheese and 1 cup of the tortilla chips.
Repeat the layers.
Bake, covered, for 30-40 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.
Take off cover the last 10 minutes of baking.
Top with lettuce and tomato before serving.

Take off cover the last 10 minutes of baking. Top with lettuce and tomato before serving.
output_sentences_v1: Take off cover the last 10 minutes of baking.

text: <TITLE_START> Rum Cake with Rum Glaze<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup chopped walnuts<INGR_NEXT> 1 box yellow cake mix<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup dark rum<INGR_NEXT> 4 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 1 package of instant vanilla pudding<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup butter or margarine<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/8 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup rum<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 325 degrees f.<INSTR_NEXT> grease and flour a 10 inch tube or bundt pan.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle nuts over the bottom of the pan.<INSTR_NEXT> mix together the cake mix, 1/2 cup dark rum, eggs, 1/2 cup water, oil, and vanilla pudding mix.<INSTR_NEXT> pour batter over the nuts in the pan.<INSTR_NEXT> bake for 1 hour.<INSTR_NEXT> cool, and invert cake on a serving plate.<INSTR_NEXT> prick the top of the cake.<INSTR_NEXT> melt butter in a saucepan.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in 1/8 cup water and sugar.<INSTR_NEXT> boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.<INSTR_NEXT> remove glaze from heat, and stir in 1/4 cup rum.<INSTR_NEXT> drizzle and smooth glaze evenly over the top and sides of the cake.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 325 degrees f.
Grease and flour a 10 inch tube or bundt pan.
Sprinkle nuts over the bottom of the pan.
Mix together the cake mix, 1/2 cup dark rum, eggs, 1/2 cup water, oil, and vanilla pudding mix.
Pour batter over the nuts in the pan.
Bake for 1 hour.
Cool, and invert cake on a serving plate.
Prick the top of the cake.
Melt butter in a saucepan.
Stir in 1/8 cup water and sugar.
Boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove glaze from heat, and stir in 1/4 cup rum.
Drizzle and smooth glaze evenly over the top and sides of the cake.

text: <TITLE_START> Beef and Pasta With Mushroom Sauce and Vegetables<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb beef, strips<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon oil<INGR_NEXT> 2 cans cream of mushroom soup<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups water<INGR_NEXT> 1 package lipton recipe secrets garlic and herb soup mix<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 4 cups penne pasta or 4 cups bow tie pasta or 4 cups rotini pasta<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup sliced mushrooms<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup sugar snap peas or 1 cup frozen mixed vegetables<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese<INGR_END><INSTR_START> cook pasta in a large pot.<INSTR_NEXT> strain and run cold water through.<INSTR_NEXT> cook beef in large non-stick skillet over medium heat with a little oil for about 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> dissolve soup mix in water and add 2 cans mushroom soup to lipton soup mixture and mix.<INSTR_NEXT> pour over beef, add nutmeg and mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> cover, bring to boil and simmer 10 minutes, stir often.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in cooked pasta, mushrooms and peas or your choice of vegetables.<INSTR_NEXT> (as an alteration, you can cook the pasta in the pot with the beef and soup.<INSTR_NEXT> add 3 cups of water instead of 2 and simmer until pasta is cooked, stirring often) cook 10 minutes or until heated through stirring often.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat and toss with grated parmesan cheese.<INSTR_NEXT> leftovers can be used as a side dish for the next day's dinner.<INSTR_NEXT> i served it with sliced london broil the next night.<INSTR_NEXT> you can also substitute chicken for the beef or vegetarians can omit the meat altogether.<INSTR_END>
input: Beef and Pasta With Mushroom Sauce and Vegetables
ingredients: 1 package lipton recipe secrets garlic and herb soup mix
4 cups penne pasta or 4 cups bow tie pasta or 4 cups rotini pasta
1 cup sugar snap peas or 1 cup frozen mixed vegetables
output_sentences: Cook pasta in a large pot.
Strain and run cold water through.
Cook beef in large non-stick skillet over medium heat with a little oil for about 5 minutes.
Dissolve soup mix in water and add 2 cans mushroom soup to lipton soup mixture and mix.
Pour over beef, add nutmeg and mix well.
Cover, bring to boil and simmer 10 minutes, stir often.
Stir in cooked pasta, mushrooms and peas or your choice of vegetables.
(as an alteration, you can cook the pasta in the pot with the beef and soup.
Add 3 cups of water instead of 2 and simmer until pasta is cooked, stirring often) cook 10 minutes or until heated through stirring often.
Remove from heat and toss with grated parmesan cheese.
Leftovers can be used as a side dish for the next day's dinner.
I served it with sliced london broil the next night.
You can also substitute chicken for the beef or vegetarians can omit the meat altogether.
output: Cook pasta in a large pot. Strain and run cold water through. Cook beef in large non-stick skillet over medium heat with a little oil for about 5 minutes. Dissolve soup mix in water and add 2 cans mushroom soup to lipton soup mixture and mix. Pour over beef, add nutmeg and mix well. Cover, bring to boil and simmer 10 minutes, stir often. Stir in cooked pasta, mushrooms and peas or your choice of vegetables. (as an alteration, you can cook the pasta in the pot with the beef and soup. Add 3 cups of water instead of 2 and simmer until pasta is cooked, stirring often) cook 10 minutes or until heated through stirring often. Remove from heat and toss with grated parmesan cheese. You can also substitute chicken for the beef or vegetarians can omit the meat altogether.

text: <TITLE_START> Quick Skillet Macaroni and Cheese<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 8 ounces elbow macaroni<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon flour<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup heavy cream<INGR_NEXT> 34 teaspoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 1 garlic clove, minced<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups cheddar cheese, grated, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook macaroni 8-10 minutes until al dente.<INSTR_NEXT> drain well and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> while the macaroni cooks, melt butter over medium heat in an oven safe skillet or saucepan.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion and cook, stirring often until soft and golden.<INSTR_NEXT> add flour and cook, stirring for 2 minutes until flour is combined and mixture is light brown.<INSTR_NEXT> whisking constantly, add cream slowly until well mixed.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in pepper, salt, nutmeg and garlic.<INSTR_NEXT> bring mixture to a boil, stirring.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in 1 1/2 cups of the cheese, a little at a time, until melted.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the macaroni to coat with sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle with remaining cheese and parsley on top.<INSTR_NEXT> place skillet under broiler for 2 or 3 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook macaroni 8-10 minutes until al dente.
Drain well and set aside.
While the macaroni cooks, melt butter over medium heat in an oven safe skillet or saucepan.
Add onion and cook, stirring often until soft and golden.
Add flour and cook, stirring for 2 minutes until flour is combined and mixture is light brown.
Whisking constantly, add cream slowly until well mixed.
Stir in pepper, salt, nutmeg and garlic.
Bring mixture to a boil, stirring.
Stir in 1 1/2 cups of the cheese, a little at a time, until melted.
Stir in the macaroni to coat with sauce.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and parsley on top.
Place skillet under broiler for 2 or 3 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.

While the macaroni cooks, melt butter over medium heat in an oven safe skillet or saucepan. Add onion and cook, stirring often until soft and golden. Add flour and cook, stirring for 2 minutes until flour is combined and mixture is light brown. Whisking constantly, add cream slowly until well mixed. Stir in pepper, salt, nutmeg and garlic. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of the cheese, a little at a time, until melted. Stir in the macaroni to coat with sauce. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and parsley on top. Place skillet under broiler for 2 or 3 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.

text: <TITLE_START> Fantabulous Cherry Tomato Salad<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 12 lb cherry tomatoes, halved<INGR_NEXT> 1 celery rib, peeled and diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 carrot, peeled and diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 zucchini, diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 can black beans, well rinsed and dried<INGR_NEXT> 12 lb fresh mozzarella cheese, diced<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup pistachios, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 8 basil leaves, chiffonade<INGR_NEXT> 1 baguette, day old and cubed<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon thyme<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon mustard<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon sugar<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon kosher salt<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup wine vinegar<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup olive oil<INGR_END><INSTR_START> mix all salad ingredients together.<INSTR_NEXT> dressing: whiz the thyme, mustard, sugar, salt and pepper in a mini food processor or whisk by hand.<INSTR_NEXT> add the vinegar and whiz until all is blended well.<INSTR_NEXT> while whizzing, drizzle in the oil and continue whizzing or whisking until all is emulsified.<INSTR_NEXT> toss dressing and salad together and serve within 20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> i actually like this dressed way ahead of time so the bread cubes soak up the dressing.<INSTR_NEXT> serves 4 - 8 depending on your meal.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 can black beans, well rinsed and dried
output_sentences: Mix all salad ingredients together.
Dressing: whiz the thyme, mustard, sugar, salt and pepper in a mini food processor or whisk by hand.
Add the vinegar and whiz until all is blended well.
While whizzing, drizzle in the oil and continue whizzing or whisking until all is emulsified.
Toss dressing and salad together and serve within 20 minutes.
I actually like this dressed way ahead of time so the bread cubes soak up the dressing.
Serves 4 - 8 depending on your meal.

text: <TITLE_START> Rosemary Focaccia Bread<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 5 12 cups unsifted bread flour<INGR_NEXT> 1 package fast rising yeast<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 teaspoons salt<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups warm water<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons olive oil, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon kosher salt or 1 teaspoon sea salt<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a large mixing bowl, combine flour, yeast, 1 tablespoon rosemary and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt.<INSTR_NEXT> with a wooden spoon, stir in water and 3 tablespoons olive oil; beat mixture vigorously for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> cover bowl with a clean towel and let dough rise in a warm place, away from drafts, until doubled in size .<INSTR_NEXT> turn dough onto a floured surface and gently knead for one minute.<INSTR_NEXT> lightly oil two large baking sheets .<INSTR_NEXT> divide dough in half, placing one half on each baking sheet.<INSTR_NEXT> press or roll out each to a 10-inch round.<INSTR_NEXT> cover rounds with clean towels and let rise until doubled in size .<INSTR_NEXT> preheat oven to 400f.<INSTR_NEXT> with finger tips, make indentions all over surface of focaccia and brush each round with 1/2 tablespoon remaining olive oil.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle rounds with remaining rosemary and sea salt.<INSTR_NEXT> bake 15 minutes or until golden.<INSTR_NEXT> cut in wedges and serve warm.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 teaspoon kosher salt or 1 teaspoon sea salt
output_sentences: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, yeast, 1 tablespoon rosemary and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt.
With a wooden spoon, stir in water and 3 tablespoons olive oil; beat mixture vigorously for 5 minutes.
Cover bowl with a clean towel and let dough rise in a warm place, away from drafts, until doubled in size .
Turn dough onto a floured surface and gently knead for one minute.
Lightly oil two large baking sheets .
Divide dough in half, placing one half on each baking sheet.
Press or roll out each to a 10-inch round.
Cover rounds with clean towels and let rise until doubled in size .
Preheat oven to 400f.
With finger tips, make indentions all over surface of focaccia and brush each round with 1/2 tablespoon remaining olive oil.
Sprinkle rounds with remaining rosemary and sea salt.
Bake 15 minutes or until golden.
Cut in wedges and serve warm.

text: <TITLE_START> Oranges and Figs in Spiced Red Wine<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cups red wine<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup sugar<INGR_NEXT> tied in cheesecloth: 1 inch piece of cinnamon stick; 4 star anise, 4 cardamom pods and 2 whole cloves<INGR_NEXT> 6 large navel oranges, peeled, pith removed and cut in half lengthwise<INGR_NEXT> 12 dried figs, halved<INGR_NEXT> 1/3 cup walnuts or pistachios, chopped<INGR_END><INSTR_START> combine the wine, sugar and bouquet garni in a saucepan large enough to contain the oranges and figs in a single layer.<INSTR_NEXT> bring to a simmer, covered, over moderate heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add the figs and simmer for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the oranges and turn them for 3 to 4 minutes, turning them so they cook evenly.<INSTR_NEXT> turn the heat off and let the oranges and figs cool in the syrup.<INSTR_NEXT> remove them to a serving bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce the syrup by half and let cool.<INSTR_NEXT> discard bouquet garni and spoon syrup over figs and oranges.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish with walnuts or pistachios if you wish.<INSTR_END>
input: Oranges and Figs in Spiced Red Wine
ingredients: Tied in cheesecloth: 1 inch piece of cinnamon stick; 4 star anise, 4 cardamom pods and 2 whole cloves
6 large navel oranges, peeled, pith removed and cut in half lengthwise
output_sentences: Combine the wine, sugar and bouquet garni in a saucepan large enough to contain the oranges and figs in a single layer.
Bring to a simmer, covered, over moderate heat.
Add the figs and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the oranges and turn them for 3 to 4 minutes, turning them so they cook evenly.
Turn the heat off and let the oranges and figs cool in the syrup.
Remove them to a serving bowl.
Reduce the syrup by half and let cool.
Discard bouquet garni and spoon syrup over figs and oranges.
Garnish with walnuts or pistachios if you wish.

text: <TITLE_START> Veggie Stuffed Onions<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 large sweet onions, peeled<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups frozen vegetable medley, thawed<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons herb garden seasoning<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup shredded cheddar<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat grill to medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> slice off the top third of each onion and set aside; save tops.<INSTR_NEXT> slice an "x" in the inner 2/3 off each onion.<INSTR_NEXT> using a spoon remove the inside of the onion forming a bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> dice the removed inner section of the onions and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> in a medium bowl combine the vegetable medley, diced onion, herb garden seasoning and cheese.<INSTR_NEXT> evenly divide the mixture into each onion bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> top each filled onion with a tablespoon of butter.<INSTR_NEXT> cover the onion with its original top.<INSTR_NEXT> wrap with 2 layers of foil and place on the grill or in a preheated 400 degree f oven.<INSTR_NEXT> grill or bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until onions are tender.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat grill to medium heat.
Slice off the top third of each onion and set aside; save tops.
Slice an "x" in the inner 2/3 off each onion.
Using a spoon remove the inside of the onion forming a bowl.
Dice the removed inner section of the onions and set aside.
In a medium bowl combine the vegetable medley, diced onion, herb garden seasoning and cheese.
Evenly divide the mixture into each onion bowl.
Top each filled onion with a tablespoon of butter.
Cover the onion with its original top.
Wrap with 2 layers of foil and place on the grill or in a preheated 400 degree f oven.
Grill or bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until onions are tender.

Dish and serve. Cook until onions are beginning to turn translucent. Cook until steak is cooked how you like it. Cut steak into bite sized chunks or slices.

text: <TITLE_START> Homemade Mushroom Soup for Two<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cups fresh mushrooms, cleaned and chopped finely<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 3 garlic cloves, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme<INGR_NEXT> 1 bay leaf<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup chicken stock<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon flour dissolved in 1 tbsp water<INGR_NEXT> kosher salt or sea salt<INGR_NEXT> fresh ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup heavy cream<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 dash nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> fresh parsley or thyme<INGR_END><INSTR_START> heat olive oil in a sauce pan.<INSTR_NEXT> add butter and lightly saute garlic over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add in mushrooms, thyme, bay leaf and worcestershire sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> cook for 5 minutes or until the moisture from the mushrooms disappears.<INSTR_NEXT> add in chicken broth.<INSTR_NEXT> stir occasionally until broth boils, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the flour/water mixture and stir constantly until the mixture thickens.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.<INSTR_NEXT> taste and adjust seasoning.<INSTR_NEXT> finally, add milk and heavy cream and bring to a simmer.<INSTR_NEXT> turn heat off.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish with fresh parsley or thyme.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 2 cups fresh mushrooms, cleaned and chopped finely
1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme
1 tablespoon flour dissolved in 1 tbsp water
output_sentences: Heat olive oil in a sauce pan.
Add butter and lightly saute garlic over medium heat.
Add in mushrooms, thyme, bay leaf and worcestershire sauce.
Cook for 5 minutes or until the moisture from the mushrooms disappears.
Add in chicken broth.
Stir occasionally until broth boils, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the flour/water mixture and stir constantly until the mixture thickens.
Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Finally, add milk and heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Turn heat off.
Garnish with fresh parsley or thyme.

text: <TITLE_START> Chicken biriyani/ spicy chicken rice<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 kg boneless but with-bone chicken is also fine<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 cup curd<INGR_NEXT> 3 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp garlic paste<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp ginger paste<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tbsp red chilli paste<INGR_NEXT> 2 tomatoes chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion thinly sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 potato sliced<INGR_NEXT> 3 cup rice / long rice<INGR_NEXT> 2 cup warm milk<INGR_NEXT> 4 tbsp oil<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tsp cumin seeds<INGR_NEXT> 5 dried rose petals<INGR_NEXT> 10 mint<INGR_NEXT> 1 bay leaf<INGR_NEXT> 1 clove<INGR_NEXT> 1 green cardamom<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp dried fenugreek leaves<INGR_NEXT> 1 saffron<INGR_END><INSTR_START> firstly, marinate the chicken pieces for 3-4 hours minimum or till 24 hours if possible.<INSTR_NEXT> in this add only half of the quantity of the pastes which is mentioned and save half for later.<INSTR_NEXT> also take rice if possible and soak them in milk for an hour approx.<INSTR_NEXT> now take a small frying pan and add oil into it den add onions and fry till crispy brown then add tomatoes.<INSTR_NEXT> after removing excess water from the mixture, off the gas.<INSTR_NEXT> now in a pressure cooker, add about 4-5 spoons of oil .<INSTR_NEXT> then add all the dry spices mentioned below.<INSTR_NEXT> after this add half saved pastes of ginger, garlic and red chilli.<INSTR_NEXT> now after this add chicken marination along with the extra liquid to cooker and saute it very well for about 10 mins.<INSTR_NEXT> also add dried fenugreek to it.<INSTR_NEXT> at the end add soaked rice along with left over milk in it.<INSTR_NEXT> also add some mint leaves abd soaked saffron to it for a nice fragrance.<INSTR_NEXT> after 10-15 mins it will b ready...<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1/2 kg boneless but with-bone chicken is also fine
output_sentences: Firstly, marinate the chicken pieces for 3-4 hours minimum or till 24 hours if possible.
In this add only half of the quantity of the pastes which is mentioned and save half for later.
Also take rice if possible and soak them in milk for an hour approx.
Now take a small frying pan and add oil into it den add onions and fry till crispy brown then add tomatoes.
After removing excess water from the mixture, off the gas.
Now in a pressure cooker, add about 4-5 spoons of oil .
Then add all the dry spices mentioned below.
After this add half saved pastes of ginger, garlic and red chilli.
Now after this add chicken marination along with the extra liquid to cooker and saute it very well for about 10 mins.
Also add dried fenugreek to it.
At the end add soaked rice along with left over milk in it.
Also add some mint leaves abd soaked saffron to it for a nice fragrance.
After 10-15 mins it will b ready...

text: <TITLE_START> GBK Lamb and Barley Stew<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 lbs leg of lamb or 3 lbs lamb shoulder, boned, trimmed & cubed<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons flour<INGR_NEXT> 3 slices bacon, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 2 medium onions, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 2 medium carrots, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 4 ounces turnips, diced<INGR_NEXT> 2 sticks celery, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons pearl barley<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons mixed herbs, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 12 pint lamb or 12 pint beef stock<INGR_NEXT> fresh parsley, chopped for garnish<INGR_END><INSTR_START> toss the lamb in the flour.<INSTR_NEXT> dry fry the bacon in a large flameproof casserole.<INSTR_NEXT> add the butter and the lamb and fry until browned all over, stirring.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the lamb and bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> add the onions, carrots, turnip and celery to the casserole and saute for 5-10 minutes until they are beginning to brown.<INSTR_NEXT> return the lamb to the casserole, add the pearl barley and herbs and pour in the stock.<INSTR_NEXT> bring to the boil, then cover and simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent it sticking, until the lamb is tender.<INSTR_NEXT> serve hot, sprinkled with chopped parsley.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 3 lbs leg of lamb or 3 lbs lamb shoulder, boned, trimmed & cubed
12 pint lamb or 12 pint beef stock
output_sentences: Toss the lamb in the flour.
Dry fry the bacon in a large flameproof casserole.
Add the butter and the lamb and fry until browned all over, stirring.
Remove the lamb and bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the onions, carrots, turnip and celery to the casserole and saute for 5-10 minutes until they are beginning to brown.
Return the lamb to the casserole, add the pearl barley and herbs and pour in the stock.
Bring to the boil, then cover and simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent it sticking, until the lamb is tender.
Serve hot, sprinkled with chopped parsley.

Return the lamb to the casserole, add the pearl barley and herbs and pour in the stock. Bring to the boil, then cover and simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent it sticking, until the lamb is tender. Serve hot, sprinkled with chopped parsley.

text: <TITLE_START> Pickled Beets And Onions Recipe<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cans sliced or possibly shoestring beets<INGR_NEXT> 1 red onion, sliced and separated<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp. sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon oregano<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 teaspoon pickling spice<INGR_NEXT> vinegar<INGR_END><INSTR_START> open beets and pour into larger jar.<INSTR_NEXT> add in sugar, oregano, and pickling spice.<INSTR_NEXT> stir gently to mix it up, cover with vinegar but no more than 1 c., no less than 1/3 c.. chill at least 2 days.<INSTR_NEXT> this keeps in refrigerator forever.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with green salads.<INSTR_END>

output_sentences: Open beets and pour into larger jar.

Stir gently to mix it up, cover with vinegar but no more than 1 c., no less than 1/3 c.. chill at least 2 days.
This keeps in refrigerator forever.
Serve with green salads.

text: <TITLE_START> Quinoa and Cauliflower Salad with Popped Sorghum<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup small cauliflower florets<INGR_NEXT> 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil<INGR_NEXT> kosher salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup red quinoa, rinsed<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup white quinoa, rinsed<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil, if popping sorghum<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup popping sorghum, or 2 cups popped sorghum<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon minced chives<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon unseasoned rice vinegar<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat the oven to 350.<INSTR_NEXT> on a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle the cauliflower with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, season with salt and toss to coat.<INSTR_NEXT> roast for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and golden brown.<INSTR_NEXT> meanwhile, bring 2 medium saucepans of lightly salted water to a simmer.<INSTR_NEXT> cook the red quinoa and white quinoa separately over moderate heat until tender, 12 to 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> drain and rinse under cold running water.<INSTR_NEXT> if popping sorghum, heat the vegetable oil in a medium, heavy pot until almost smoking.<INSTR_NEXT> add the sorghum, cover and cook over moderately high heat, shaking the pot occasionally, until the popping has almost stopped; pour into a bowl and season with salt.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, red and white quinoa, almonds, chives, rice vinegar and the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and toss well.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer the salad to plates, top with the popped sorghum and serve.<INSTR_END>
input: Quinoa and Cauliflower Salad with Popped Sorghum
ingredients: 1/4 cup vegetable oil, if popping sorghum
1/4 cup popping sorghum, or 2 cups popped sorghum
output_sentences: Preheat the oven to 350.
On a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle the cauliflower with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, season with salt and toss to coat.
Roast for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and golden brown.
Meanwhile, bring 2 medium saucepans of lightly salted water to a simmer.
Cook the red quinoa and white quinoa separately over moderate heat until tender, 12 to 15 minutes.
Drain and rinse under cold running water.
If popping sorghum, heat the vegetable oil in a medium, heavy pot until almost smoking.
Add the sorghum, cover and cook over moderately high heat, shaking the pot occasionally, until the popping has almost stopped; pour into a bowl and season with salt.
In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, red and white quinoa, almonds, chives, rice vinegar and the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil.
Season with salt and toss well.
Transfer the salad to plates, top with the popped sorghum and serve.
output: Preheat the oven to 350. On a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle the cauliflower with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, season with salt and toss to coat. Roast for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and golden brown. Meanwhile, bring 2 medium saucepans of lightly salted water to a simmer. Cook the red quinoa and white quinoa separately over moderate heat until tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water. If popping sorghum, heat the vegetable oil in a medium, heavy pot until almost smoking. Add the sorghum, cover and cook over moderately high heat, shaking the pot occasionally, until the popping has almost stopped; pour into a bowl and season with salt. In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, red and white quinoa, almonds, chives, rice vinegar and the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. Season with salt and toss well. Transfer the salad to plates, top with the popped sorghum and serve.
output_sentences_v1: Season with salt and toss well.

text: <TITLE_START> Hot Vanilla<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 14 ounces whole milk<INGR_NEXT> 2 ounces whipping cream<INGR_NEXT> 12 vanilla bean<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 teaspoons sugar, to taste<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a heavy saucepan, combine the ingredients and warm over low heat.<INSTR_NEXT> when small bubbles appear around the sides of the pan, remove it from the heat and let the mixture sit at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> place the pan back on the stove and rewarm the mixture, whisking it briefly to redistribute the skin that forms on the milk's surface.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the vanilla bean half, scrape out the seeds with a sharp knife, and return the seeds to the milk.<INSTR_NEXT> pour the vanilla milk into two 8-ounce mugs and top with sprinklings of cinnamon.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Broccoli, Leek, and Potato Soup<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 slices bacon, diced<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 3 large leeks, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 3 stalks celery, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups chicken stock<INGR_NEXT> 3 yukon gold potatoes, cubed<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon herbes de provence<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon fennel seed, crushed<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups broccoli florets<INGR_NEXT> 2 1/2 cups whole milk<INGR_NEXT> 3 green onions, chopped<INGR_END><INSTR_START> stir the bacon and olive oil in a large pot over medium heat until the bacon has turned golden brown and released its grease, about 7 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the butter, leeks, onion, and celery.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and stir until the leeks have softened, about 7 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> pour in the chicken stock, potatoes, herbes de provence, coriander, fennel, salt, and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the potatoes are just beginning to turn tender, about 8 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the broccoli, and simmer 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the milk, and continue simmering until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes more.<INSTR_NEXT> pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.<INSTR_NEXT> hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree.<INSTR_NEXT> puree in batches until smooth and pour into a clean pot.<INSTR_NEXT> alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup right in the cooking pot.<INSTR_NEXT> season to taste with additional salt and pepper; sprinkle with chopped green onions to serve.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Stir the bacon and olive oil in a large pot over medium heat until the bacon has turned golden brown and released its grease, about 7 minutes.
Add the butter, leeks, onion, and celery.
Cook and stir until the leeks have softened, about 7 minutes.
Pour in the chicken stock, potatoes, herbes de provence, coriander, fennel, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the potatoes are just beginning to turn tender, about 8 minutes.
Stir in the broccoli, and simmer 5 minutes.
Add the milk, and continue simmering until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes more.
Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.
Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree.
Puree in batches until smooth and pour into a clean pot.
Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup right in the cooking pot.
Season to taste with additional salt and pepper; sprinkle with chopped green onions to serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Poor Man or Depression Cookies<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup raisins<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups water<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups margarine or butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon allspice<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoons cloves<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 1 whole egg<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups flour<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a medium-sized saucepan, boil 1 cup raisins in 2 cup water until approximately 1 cup of liquid remains.<INSTR_NEXT> cool slightly and add all of the remaining ingredients.<INSTR_NEXT> mix until blended.<INSTR_NEXT> pour into a greased jelly roll pan.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 350 degrees for 20 25 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> glaze with a thin powdered sugar frosting if you like.<INSTR_NEXT> note: if you make this with just one cup of flour, it makes a nice pudding-like dessert topped with whipping cream.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Simple Takana Fried Rice<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 200 grams cooked rice<INGR_NEXT> 50 grams takana<INGR_NEXT> 1 egg<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp soy sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp mayonnaise<INGR_NEXT> 1 dash salt and pepper<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp sesame oil<INGR_END><INSTR_START> crack the eggs, beat, and add a little salt.<INSTR_NEXT> make soft scrambled egg in a frying pan with a little oil, transfer to a plate and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> add sesame oil to the same frying pan from step 1, add the minced takana and cook.<INSTR_NEXT> add the rice and cook while mixing everything together.<INSTR_NEXT> once the rice has been crumbled in, add the mayonnaise and soy sauce and cook while mixing.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and pepper to taste.<INSTR_NEXT> mix in the scrambled egg and it's complete.<INSTR_END>
