text: <TITLE_START> Moroccan Harira (Bean Soup)<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 6 cups beef stock<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup dry lentils<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 cinnamon stick<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground turmeric<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground cumin<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 can garbanzo beans, drained<INGR_NEXT> 1 can red kidney beans, rinsed and drained<INGR_NEXT> 1 can diced tomatoes<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup cooked quinoa<INGR_NEXT> 1 bunch flat-leaf parsley leaves and thinner stems, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 bunch cilantro leaves and thinner stems, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 lemon, or to taste, juiced<INGR_END><INSTR_START> stir beef stock and lentils together in a large pot; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and keep at a simmer while preparing onion.<INSTR_NEXT> heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and stir onion, cinnamon stick, ginger, turmeric, cumin, and black pepper in the hot oil until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes; add to stock mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> pour garbanzo beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, and quinoa into the stock mixture; stir and bring mixture to a boil.<INSTR_NEXT> stir parsley and cilantro into the stock mixture; reduce heat to low and cook mixture at a simmer until the lentils are tender, about 45 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> drizzle lemon juice over the soup before serving.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste
1 can red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 bunch flat-leaf parsley leaves and thinner stems, chopped
1 bunch cilantro leaves and thinner stems, chopped
output_sentences: Stir beef stock and lentils together in a large pot; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and keep at a simmer while preparing onion.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook and stir onion, cinnamon stick, ginger, turmeric, cumin, and black pepper in the hot oil until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes; add to stock mixture.
Pour garbanzo beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, and quinoa into the stock mixture; stir and bring mixture to a boil.
Stir parsley and cilantro into the stock mixture; reduce heat to low and cook mixture at a simmer until the lentils are tender, about 45 minutes.
Drizzle lemon juice over the soup before serving.

text: <TITLE_START> Curried Cutlet Saute<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb. thin cutlets<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 tsp. salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 tsp. coarsely ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 tsp. olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 small onion<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 tsp. curry powder<INGR_NEXT> 1 can stewed tomatoes<INGR_NEXT> apple slices<INGR_NEXT> plain yogurt<INGR_END><INSTR_START> prepare cutlets: if necessary, pound cutlets to 1/4-inch thickness.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle cutlets with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> in nonstick 12-inch skillet, heat 2 teaspoons olive oil over medium-high heat until hot.<INSTR_NEXT> add cutlets and cook 5 to 6 minutes, until golden, turning once.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer cutlets to platter; cover with foil to keep warm.<INSTR_NEXT> prepare sauce: in same skillet, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat until hot.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion and curry powder with 2 tablespoons water.<INSTR_NEXT> cover skillet and cook 6 to 8 minutes, until ingredients are tender and lightly browned.<INSTR_NEXT> add tomatoes and cook over medium heat, 10 minutes, covered.<INSTR_NEXT> to serve, pour sauce over warm cutlets.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish with apple slices or plain yogurt, if you like.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Prepare cutlets: if necessary, pound cutlets to 1/4-inch thickness.
Sprinkle cutlets with salt and pepper.
In nonstick 12-inch skillet, heat 2 teaspoons olive oil over medium-high heat until hot.
Add cutlets and cook 5 to 6 minutes, until golden, turning once.
Transfer cutlets to platter; cover with foil to keep warm.
Prepare sauce: in same skillet, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat until hot.
Add onion and curry powder with 2 tablespoons water.
Cover skillet and cook 6 to 8 minutes, until ingredients are tender and lightly browned.
Add tomatoes and cook over medium heat, 10 minutes, covered.
To serve, pour sauce over warm cutlets.
Garnish with apple slices or plain yogurt, if you like.
output: Prepare cutlets: if necessary, pound cutlets to 1/4-inch thickness. Sprinkle cutlets with salt and pepper. In nonstick 12-inch skillet, heat 2 teaspoons olive oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add cutlets and cook 5 to 6 minutes, until golden, turning once. Transfer cutlets to platter; cover with foil to keep warm. Prepare sauce: in same skillet, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat until hot. Add onion and curry powder with 2 tablespoons water. Cover skillet and cook 6 to 8 minutes, until ingredients are tender and lightly browned. Add tomatoes and cook over medium heat, 10 minutes, covered. To serve, pour sauce over warm cutlets. Garnish with apple slices or plain yogurt, if you like.

text: <TITLE_START> Star Fruit Chips (Carambola)<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 12 lb star fruit, firm ripe<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups water<INGR_END><INSTR_START> slice star fruit crosswise with slicer into 1/16-inch-thick slices.<INSTR_NEXT> bring sugar and water to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved.<INSTR_NEXT> add star fruit, then remove from heat and let stand, uncovered, 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> preheat oven to 200 f with rack in the middle.<INSTR_NEXT> with a strainer set over a pan or bowl, strain and drain 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> reserve syrup for another use.<INSTR_NEXT> arrange star-fruit slices in 1 layer on silpat in 11x17" pan.<INSTR_NEXT> use parchment paper if you don't have siplat.<INSTR_NEXT> bake until dry, 1 to 1 1/4 hours.<INSTR_NEXT> immediately transfer chips to a rack to cool.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Chicken Paprikas<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 skinless boneless chicken breast halves, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips<INGR_NEXT> 4 teaspoons paprika, preferably hungarian sweet<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup chopped onion<INGR_NEXT> 1 large plum tomato, seeded, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup canned low-salt chicken broth<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup regular or reduced-fat sour cream<INGR_END><INSTR_START> season chicken with 1 teaspoon paprika, salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> melt 1 tablespoon butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add chicken and saute until just cooked through, about 3 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> using slotted spoon, transfer chicken to plate.<INSTR_NEXT> add remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter to same skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion and saute until beginning to soften, about 3 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add remaining 3 teaspoons paprika; stir 10 seconds.<INSTR_NEXT> add tomato and stir until beginning to soften, about 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> increase heat to high and boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon thinly, about 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> mix in chicken and any collected juices.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce heat to low.<INSTR_NEXT> add sour cream and stir just until heated through .<INSTR_NEXT> season paprik s to taste with salt and pepper and serve.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 2 skinless boneless chicken breast halves, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips
1/4 cup regular or reduced-fat sour cream
output_sentences: Season chicken with 1 teaspoon paprika, salt and pepper.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and saute until just cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Using slotted spoon, transfer chicken to plate.
Add remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter to same skillet.
Add onion and saute until beginning to soften, about 3 minutes.
Add remaining 3 teaspoons paprika; stir 10 seconds.
Add tomato and stir until beginning to soften, about 1 minute.
Increase heat to high and boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon thinly, about 5 minutes.
Mix in chicken and any collected juices.
Reduce heat to low.
Add sour cream and stir just until heated through .
Season paprik s to taste with salt and pepper and serve.

Add tomato and stir until beginning to soften, about 1 minute. Add chicken and saute until just cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter to same skillet. Season chicken with 1 teaspoon paprika, salt and pepper.

text: <TITLE_START> French Lasagne<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 cups whole milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 clove garlic, peeled and lightly crushed<INGR_NEXT> 4 large eggs, beaten together<INGR_NEXT> 5 stale croissants, halved lengthwise<INGR_NEXT> 5 thin slices ham<INGR_NEXT> 1 4-ounce ball fresh mozzarella, cut into 5 slices<INGR_NEXT> 8 ounces grated cheddar<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a medium saucepan, combine milk and garlic, and place over high heat until almost at boiling point.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat and allow to rest for 15 to 20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> discard garlic, and drizzle eggs into milk while whisking vigorously.<INSTR_NEXT> place bottoms of croissants into a baking dish large enough to hold them snugly in a single layer.<INSTR_NEXT> on each croissant half, arrange a slice of ham and a slice of mozzarella.<INSTR_NEXT> top with remaining croissant halves.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle about 2/3 of cheddar on croissants, and pour milk mixture over everything.<INSTR_NEXT> press croissants down with a fork so they are almost covered by milk, repeating once or twice until tops absorb some of liquid.<INSTR_NEXT> set aside for 20 minutes; meanwhile, heat oven to 325 degrees.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle remaining cheddar over croissants.<INSTR_NEXT> bake until puffy, golden and set, about 30 minutes.<INSTR_END>

1 4-ounce ball fresh mozzarella, cut into 5 slices

Press croissants down with a fork so they are almost covered by milk, repeating once or twice until tops absorb some of liquid.
Set aside for 20 minutes; meanwhile, heat oven to 325 degrees.
Sprinkle remaining cheddar over croissants.
Bake until puffy, golden and set, about 30 minutes.

text: <TITLE_START> Peach & Cream Cheese Muffins<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cups flour<INGR_NEXT> 4 teaspoons baking powder<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoons salt<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons melted butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 whole egg<INGR_NEXT> 5 whole fresh peaches<INGR_NEXT> 8 ounces, weight cream cheese<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoons almond extract<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups slivered almonds<INGR_END><INSTR_START> sift together the dry ingredients .<INSTR_NEXT> in another bowl, mix the melted butter with the milk and egg.<INSTR_NEXT> beat and add to the dry ingredients.<INSTR_NEXT> peel, pit and slice the peaches into cubes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the peaches to the batter mixture and fold in.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon the muffin mix into a 12-count muffin pan.<INSTR_NEXT> cream together the cream cheese, sugar and almond extract until smooth.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon the cream cheese mixture into the middle of each muffin.<INSTR_NEXT> bake the muffins at 425f for 15-20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> once cooled, sprinkle the slivered almonds onto the top of each muffin.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Sift together the dry ingredients .
In another bowl, mix the melted butter with the milk and egg.
Beat and add to the dry ingredients.
Peel, pit and slice the peaches into cubes.
Add the peaches to the batter mixture and fold in.
Spoon the muffin mix into a 12-count muffin pan.
Cream together the cream cheese, sugar and almond extract until smooth.
Spoon the cream cheese mixture into the middle of each muffin.
Bake the muffins at 425f for 15-20 minutes.
Once cooled, sprinkle the slivered almonds onto the top of each muffin.

text: <TITLE_START> Basic Polenta<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 1/2 cups organic cornmeal of any coarseness or quick-cooking cornmeal<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 2 1/2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil<INGR_END><INSTR_START> pour 2 1/2 quarts cold water into a saucepan.<INSTR_NEXT> turn the heat to medium and stir in the cornmeal, salt, and olive oil.<INSTR_NEXT> when the polenta starts to boil, reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook, stirring constantly, for 40 to 45 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> if lumps form, use a whisk to get them out.<INSTR_NEXT> the polenta is ready when it has the consistency of cream of wheat.<INSTR_NEXT> if it is too stiff, stir in a little hot water.<INSTR_END>

Turn the heat to medium and stir in the cornmeal, salt, and olive oil.
When the polenta starts to boil, reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook, stirring constantly, for 40 to 45 minutes.
If lumps form, use a whisk to get them out.
The polenta is ready when it has the consistency of cream of wheat.
If it is too stiff, stir in a little hot water.

text: <TITLE_START> Easy Chicken And Brown Rice Recipe<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 fryer<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 c. honey<INGR_NEXT> 1/3 c. mustard<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp. lemon juice<INGR_NEXT> slice mushrooms<INGR_NEXT> 1 c. regular long grain white rice<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp. butter<INGR_NEXT> minced onion<INGR_NEXT> chicken broth<INGR_END><INSTR_START> place chicken pcs in a 9 x 13 inch dish.<INSTR_NEXT> mix honey, mustard, and lemon juice together.<INSTR_NEXT> pour over chicken and use to baste frequently while chicken cooks.<INSTR_NEXT> brown the rice in the butter.<INSTR_NEXT> season with a bit of minced onion and mushrooms.<INSTR_NEXT> add in twice as much chicken broth as rice.<INSTR_NEXT> place all in a separate casserole.<INSTR_NEXT> bake both dishes at 350 degrees for 1 hour.<INSTR_END>

Place all in a separate casserole.
Bake both dishes at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

text: <TITLE_START> Calf's Liver with Scallions Sherry, and Pancetta<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 slices calf's liver<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 3 thin slices pancetta, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon vegetable or olive oil, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup thinly sliced scallions<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup cream sherry<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons water<INGR_END><INSTR_START> soak liver in milk 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> cook pancetta in 1 teaspoon oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, leaving fat in skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> discard milk and pat liver dry.<INSTR_NEXT> stir together flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper on a piece of wax paper or a plate and dredge liver in mixture, knocking off excess.<INSTR_NEXT> add remaining 2 teaspoons oil to fat in skillet and heat over medium-high heat until hot.<INSTR_NEXT> cook liver, turning once, until browned but still pink in center, about 4 minutes total.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer to plates.<INSTR_NEXT> melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet over medium-high heat, then saute scallions until softened, about 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> add sherry, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper and boil until reduced slightly, about 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat and stir in remaining tablespoon butter until incorporated.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon over liver and sprinkle with pancetta.<INSTR_END>
input: Calf's Liver with Scallions Sherry, and Pancetta
ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable or olive oil, divided
output_sentences: Soak liver in milk 15 minutes.
Cook pancetta in 1 teaspoon oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.
Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, leaving fat in skillet.
Discard milk and pat liver dry.
Stir together flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper on a piece of wax paper or a plate and dredge liver in mixture, knocking off excess.
Add remaining 2 teaspoons oil to fat in skillet and heat over medium-high heat until hot.
Cook liver, turning once, until browned but still pink in center, about 4 minutes total.
Transfer to plates.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet over medium-high heat, then saute scallions until softened, about 1 minute.
Add sherry, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper and boil until reduced slightly, about 1 minute.
Remove from heat and stir in remaining tablespoon butter until incorporated.
Spoon over liver and sprinkle with pancetta.
output: Soak liver in milk 15 minutes. Cook pancetta in 1 teaspoon oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, leaving fat in skillet. Discard milk and pat liver dry. Stir together flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper on a piece of wax paper or a plate and dredge liver in mixture, knocking off excess. Add remaining 2 teaspoons oil to fat in skillet and heat over medium-high heat until hot. Cook liver, turning once, until browned but still pink in center, about 4 minutes total. Transfer to plates. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet over medium-high heat, then saute scallions until softened, about 1 minute. Add sherry, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper and boil until reduced slightly, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in remaining tablespoon butter until incorporated. Spoon over liver and sprinkle with pancetta.

text: <TITLE_START> Mesclun<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 pound assorted greens, carefully washed and dried<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup chervil and parsley sprigs, very loosely packed<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup light white-wine tarragon vinegar or fruit vinegar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon sugar<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup light olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> salt and freshly ground white pepper to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup herb blossoms, such as chervil, thyme, borage or sage combined with nasturtium petals or rosa rugosa petals<INGR_END><INSTR_START> wrap the washed and dried greens in paper toweling and chill until ready to serve.<INSTR_NEXT> in a small saucepan, warm the vinegar and sugar over medium heat until the sugar dissolves.<INSTR_NEXT> allow to cool.<INSTR_NEXT> whisk the oils and seasonings into the sweetened vinegar.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl, toss the greens and herb sprigs with enough vinaigrette to coat, and divide among four chilled plates.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle the salad with the blossoms and petals and serve.<INSTR_NEXT> accompany the salad with lightly toasted thick slices of crusty italian bread and any triple-cream cheese or gorgonzola and mascarpone torta.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 pound assorted greens, carefully washed and dried
1 cup chervil and parsley sprigs, very loosely packed
13 cup light white-wine tarragon vinegar or fruit vinegar
Salt and freshly ground white pepper to taste
1/2 cup herb blossoms, such as chervil, thyme, borage or sage combined with nasturtium petals or rosa rugosa petals
output_sentences: Wrap the washed and dried greens in paper toweling and chill until ready to serve.
In a small saucepan, warm the vinegar and sugar over medium heat until the sugar dissolves.
Allow to cool.
Whisk the oils and seasonings into the sweetened vinegar.
In a large bowl, toss the greens and herb sprigs with enough vinaigrette to coat, and divide among four chilled plates.
Sprinkle the salad with the blossoms and petals and serve.
Accompany the salad with lightly toasted thick slices of crusty italian bread and any triple-cream cheese or gorgonzola and mascarpone torta.
output: Wrap the washed and dried greens in paper toweling and chill until ready to serve. In a small saucepan, warm the vinegar and sugar over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Allow to cool. Whisk the oils and seasonings into the sweetened vinegar. In a large bowl, toss the greens and herb sprigs with enough vinaigrette to coat, and divide among four chilled plates. Sprinkle the salad with the blossoms and petals and serve. Accompany the salad with lightly toasted thick slices of crusty italian bread and any triple-cream cheese or gorgonzola and mascarpone torta.

text: <TITLE_START> Spicy Tomato & Green Beans<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 tablespoon butter<INGR_NEXT> 18-14 cup onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons tomato paste<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 1 can green beans, drained<INGR_END><INSTR_START> saute the onions in the butter until softened and slightly browned.<INSTR_NEXT> add the tomato paste, salt, pepper, and cinnamon and stir around.<INSTR_NEXT> it'll be a bit pasty.<INSTR_NEXT> add drained green beans and mix thoroughly.<INSTR_NEXT> make sure beans are well coated with the tomato-onion mix.<INSTR_NEXT> do this till green beans are at desired temperature.<INSTR_NEXT> serve and enjoy!<INSTR_NEXT> note: the cinnamon does make this a bit spicy - not very -- - but if you want less kick, i'd say use 1/2 teaspoons of salt, pepper, and cinnamon instead of whole.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Southern Fried Chicken<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 14 cups all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 teaspoons salt<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon ground cumin<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon dried oregano<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon paprika<INGR_NEXT> 2 broiler-fryer chickens, cut up<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon browning sauce<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a shallow bowl, beat eggs and milk.<INSTR_NEXT> in another bowl, combine flour and seasonings.<INSTR_NEXT> dip chicken pieces in egg mixture, then in flour mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> heat oil in a large skillet; brown chicken on both sides.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and cook over low heat for 45-50 minutes or until juices run clear.<INSTR_NEXT> remove chicken from skillet; keep warm.<INSTR_NEXT> drain drippings, reserving 1/4 cup in skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the flour, salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and stir over medium heat for 5 minutes or until browned.<INSTR_NEXT> combine milk and water; add to skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> bring to a boil; boil and stir for 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add browning sauce if desired.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with chicken.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: In a shallow bowl, beat eggs and milk.
In another bowl, combine flour and seasonings.
Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture, then in flour mixture.
Heat oil in a large skillet; brown chicken on both sides.
Cover and cook over low heat for 45-50 minutes or until juices run clear.

text: <TITLE_START> Yummy Smo'res Brownies<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 12 cup butter<INGR_NEXT> 16 cinnamon graham crackers<INGR_NEXT> 1 brownie mix<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 cups water<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup oil<INGR_NEXT> 3 whole eggs<INGR_NEXT> 2 cans vanilla frosting<INGR_NEXT> 1 bag marshmallows<INGR_NEXT> 1 bagcinnamon hearts candies<INGR_END><INSTR_START> crush the graham crackers in a small bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> melt 1/2 cup butter and mix with graham crackers.<INSTR_NEXT> mix up brownie mix, oil, eggs, and water.<INSTR_NEXT> make sure to mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> add marshmallows and mix with a spoon to make sure you don't break them.<INSTR_NEXT> use shortening or cooking spray to grease the sides of a 13 x 9 pan.<INSTR_NEXT> put the graham cracker mixture on the bottom of the pan, then our brownie batter over it.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 350 degrees f. for 20 minutes, or until done.<INSTR_NEXT> take out of oven and let cool completely.<INSTR_NEXT> frost with vanilla frosting.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle cinnamon hearts on top, if using.<INSTR_NEXT> i usually cut them into 9 jumbo brownies.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Crush the graham crackers in a small bowl.
Melt 1/2 cup butter and mix with graham crackers.
Mix up brownie mix, oil, eggs, and water.
Make sure to mix well.
Add marshmallows and mix with a spoon to make sure you don't break them.
Use shortening or cooking spray to grease the sides of a 13 x 9 pan.
Put the graham cracker mixture on the bottom of the pan, then our brownie batter over it.
Bake at 350 degrees f. for 20 minutes, or until done.
Take out of oven and let cool completely.
Frost with vanilla frosting.
Sprinkle cinnamon hearts on top, if using.
I usually cut them into 9 jumbo brownies.

text: <TITLE_START> Harvest Minestrone<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 tablespoon olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup chopped onion<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup diagonally sliced carrot<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 cup thinly sliced celery<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups diced tomato<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups diced peeled butternut squash<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups water<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoon black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 2 cans fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth<INGR_NEXT> 1 can cannellini beans or other white beans, rinsed and drained<INGR_NEXT> 2 garlic cloves, minced<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups small broccoli or cauliflower florets<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups thinly sliced green cabbage<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups thinly sliced collard greens or kale or spinach<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup uncooked small seashell pasta or elbow macaroni<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh or 2 teaspoons dried rubbed sage<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh or 3/4 teaspoon dried thyme<INGR_END><INSTR_START> heat oil in a large dutch oven over medium heat until hot.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion, carrot, and celery, and saute 6 minutes or until onion is tender.<INSTR_NEXT> add tomato and next 7 ingredients , and bring to a boil.<INSTR_NEXT> cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in broccoli, cabbage, greens, and pasta; cover and cook 5 minutes or until pasta is done.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in sage and thyme.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 can cannellini beans or other white beans, rinsed and drained
2 cups small broccoli or cauliflower florets
2 cups thinly sliced collard greens or kale or spinach
1/2 cup uncooked small seashell pasta or elbow macaroni
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh or 2 teaspoons dried rubbed sage
2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh or 3/4 teaspoon dried thyme

Add tomato and next 7 ingredients , and bring to a boil.

Stir in broccoli, cabbage, greens, and pasta; cover and cook 5 minutes or until pasta is done.
Stir in sage and thyme.

text: <TITLE_START> Turkey Satay with Cranberry Dipping Sauce<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 stalks lemongrass, roughly chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon ginger, finely chopped<INGR_NEXT> 5 cloves garlic, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon chili pepper, crushed<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons, curry powder<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons honey<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon fish sauce<INGR_NEXT> 2 boneless, skinless turkey breasts<INGR_NEXT> bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 1 hour<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups whole cranberry relish<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup coconut milk<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup shredded, unsweetened coconut<INGR_NEXT> 2 limes, juiced<INGR_END><INSTR_START> for the marinade, combine lemongrass, ginger, garlic, chili pepper, curry powder, honey and fish sauce in medium sized bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> slice the turkey breasts into 3 by 1-inch strips and add to the marinade, stirring to coat the turkey.<INSTR_NEXT> cover with plastic wrap and place the turkey marinade in the refrigerator overnight.<INSTR_NEXT> when ready to cook the satay, place a large saute pan on medium high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> thread the turkey meat onto the skewers and sear, turning once, until the turkey is cooked through, about 1 to 2 minutes per side.<INSTR_NEXT> mix all ingredients together in a medium sized mixing bowl and taste for seasoning.<INSTR_NEXT> serve in a small dipping bowl along side the turkey satay.<INSTR_END>
input: Turkey Satay with Cranberry Dipping Sauce
ingredients: Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 1 hour
output_sentences: For the marinade, combine lemongrass, ginger, garlic, chili pepper, curry powder, honey and fish sauce in medium sized bowl.
Slice the turkey breasts into 3 by 1-inch strips and add to the marinade, stirring to coat the turkey.
Cover with plastic wrap and place the turkey marinade in the refrigerator overnight.
When ready to cook the satay, place a large saute pan on medium high heat.
Thread the turkey meat onto the skewers and sear, turning once, until the turkey is cooked through, about 1 to 2 minutes per side.
Mix all ingredients together in a medium sized mixing bowl and taste for seasoning.
Serve in a small dipping bowl along side the turkey satay.

Slice the turkey breasts into 3 by 1-inch strips and add to the marinade, stirring to coat the turkey. Cover with plastic wrap and place the turkey marinade in the refrigerator overnight. When ready to cook the satay, place a large saute pan on medium high heat. Thread the turkey meat onto the skewers and sear, turning once, until the turkey is cooked through, about 1 to 2 minutes per side. Mix all ingredients together in a medium sized mixing bowl and taste for seasoning. Serve in a small dipping bowl along side the turkey satay.

text: <TITLE_START> Easy Strawberry Shortcake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup buttermilk baking mix<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> half and half<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups strawberries, hulled<INGR_NEXT> 3/8 cup sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 tsp. lemon juice<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup light frozen dessert topping<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 425f.<INSTR_NEXT> combine first 2 ingredients in a bowl and mix until a soft dough forms.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon dough onto an ungreased baking sheet, making 2 mounds 2 inches apart.<INSTR_NEXT> flatten mounds to about 1 inch thick.<INSTR_NEXT> bake 15-18 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> puree half the berries, sugar and lemon juice in a blender or food processor.<INSTR_NEXT> slice remaining berries and stir into puree.<INSTR_NEXT> split biscuits in half horizontally.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon half the strawberry sauce on bottoms of biscuits.<INSTR_NEXT> replace tops and drizzle with remaining sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with a dollop of topping.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 425f.
Combine first 2 ingredients in a bowl and mix until a soft dough forms.
Spoon dough onto an ungreased baking sheet, making 2 mounds 2 inches apart.
Flatten mounds to about 1 inch thick.
Bake 15-18 minutes.
Puree half the berries, sugar and lemon juice in a blender or food processor.
Slice remaining berries and stir into puree.
Split biscuits in half horizontally.
Spoon half the strawberry sauce on bottoms of biscuits.
Replace tops and drizzle with remaining sauce.
Serve with a dollop of topping.

text: <TITLE_START> Fruit Gratin<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 lbs fruit<INGR_NEXT> 3 peaches<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups crumbled macaroons or 2 cups amaretti cookies<INGR_NEXT> 8 tablespoons orange juice<INGR_NEXT> 1 grated lemon, zest of<INGR_NEXT> 2 egg whites<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons caster sugar<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon vanilla essence<INGR_NEXT> mint leaf<INGR_END><INSTR_START> clean the fruits, remove the stone of the peaches and chop in cubes.<INSTR_NEXT> put all the fruit in an oven-proof dish.<INSTR_NEXT> top with the crumbled macaroons.<INSTR_NEXT> mix the orange juice with the lemon zest and sprinkle over the fruit and cookies and leave for about half an hour.<INSTR_NEXT> preheat oven to 375f.<INSTR_NEXT> whisk the egg whites in a very clean bowl, when stiff add the sugar gradually with the vanilla essence, whisk untill glossy.<INSTR_NEXT> spread the egg whites on top of the fruit and cookie mixture, try to pattern it a bit.<INSTR_NEXT> bake for approx 10 minutes until colored to your liking.<INSTR_NEXT> serve garnished with mint and a scoop of ice cream .<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 2 cups crumbled macaroons or 2 cups amaretti cookies
output_sentences: Clean the fruits, remove the stone of the peaches and chop in cubes.
Put all the fruit in an oven-proof dish.
Top with the crumbled macaroons.
Mix the orange juice with the lemon zest and sprinkle over the fruit and cookies and leave for about half an hour.
Preheat oven to 375f.
Whisk the egg whites in a very clean bowl, when stiff add the sugar gradually with the vanilla essence, whisk untill glossy.
Spread the egg whites on top of the fruit and cookie mixture, try to pattern it a bit.
Bake for approx 10 minutes until colored to your liking.
Serve garnished with mint and a scoop of ice cream .

text: <TITLE_START> Easy Tasty Cream Stew without Store Bought Roux<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 potatoes<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 carrot<INGR_NEXT> 1 chicken thigh<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp flour<INGR_NEXT> 300 ml milk<INGR_NEXT> 200 ml water<INGR_NEXT> 2 consomme soup stock cubes<INGR_NEXT> 1 dash salt and pepper<INGR_END><INSTR_START> cut the vegetables into bite-size pieces.<INSTR_NEXT> soak the cut potatoes in water.<INSTR_NEXT> you can use the chicken with or without skin.<INSTR_NEXT> heat oil in a pot and when hot, turn off the heat and add the chicken.<INSTR_NEXT> this will prevent the chicken from sticking to the pan.<INSTR_NEXT> cook the chicken for a few minutes and add the onions and carrots.<INSTR_NEXT> cool until the onions are soft.<INSTR_NEXT> add the potatoes and cook for another few minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> lightly season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> stock cubes will be added later, so don't go overboard.<INSTR_NEXT> when everything is coated with oil, turn off the heat, sprinkle flour and mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> add milk, water, and stock cubes and turn on the heat.<INSTR_NEXT> stir from the bottom to prevent scorching and reduce the heat once it comes to a boil.<INSTR_NEXT> cook the vegetable slowly over low heat until cooked through.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and pepper, and it's done.<INSTR_END>
input: Easy Tasty Cream Stew without Store Bought Roux
output_sentences: Cut the vegetables into bite-size pieces.
Soak the cut potatoes in water.
You can use the chicken with or without skin.
Heat oil in a pot and when hot, turn off the heat and add the chicken.
This will prevent the chicken from sticking to the pan.
Cook the chicken for a few minutes and add the onions and carrots.
Cool until the onions are soft.
Add the potatoes and cook for another few minutes.
Lightly season with salt and pepper.
Stock cubes will be added later, so don't go overboard.
When everything is coated with oil, turn off the heat, sprinkle flour and mix well.
Add milk, water, and stock cubes and turn on the heat.
Stir from the bottom to prevent scorching and reduce the heat once it comes to a boil.
Cook the vegetable slowly over low heat until cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper, and it's done.
output: Cut the vegetables into bite-size pieces. Soak the cut potatoes in water. You can use the chicken with or without skin. Heat oil in a pot and when hot, turn off the heat and add the chicken. This will prevent the chicken from sticking to the pan. Cook the chicken for a few minutes and add the onions and carrots. Cool until the onions are soft. Add the potatoes and cook for another few minutes. Lightly season with salt and pepper. Stock cubes will be added later, so don't go overboard. When everything is coated with oil, turn off the heat, sprinkle flour and mix well. Add milk, water, and stock cubes and turn on the heat. Stir from the bottom to prevent scorching and reduce the heat once it comes to a boil. Cook the vegetable slowly over low heat until cooked through. Season with salt and pepper, and it's done.

text: <TITLE_START> Spinach-Potato Bake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb ground beef<INGR_NEXT> 1 small onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup mushroom, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 2 garlic cloves, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1 package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon ground nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 1 lb russet potato, peeled, cooked and mashed<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup sour cream<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup cheddar cheese, shredded<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 400f.<INSTR_NEXT> spray deep 9-inch casserole with nonstick cooking spray.<INSTR_NEXT> brown beef 6 to 8 minutes in large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring to break up meat.<INSTR_NEXT> drain fat; add onion, mushrooms and garlic, cooking until tender.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in spinach and nutmeg; cover and cook until heated through, stirring occasionally.<INSTR_NEXT> combine potatoes, sour cream and milk.<INSTR_NEXT> add beef to mixture; season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon into prepared casserole; sprinkle with cheese.<INSTR_NEXT> bake 15 to 20 minutes or until slightly puffed and cheese is melted.<INSTR_END>

1 lb russet potato, peeled, cooked and mashed
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 400f.
Spray deep 9-inch casserole with nonstick cooking spray.
Brown beef 6 to 8 minutes in large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring to break up meat.
Drain fat; add onion, mushrooms and garlic, cooking until tender.
Stir in spinach and nutmeg; cover and cook until heated through, stirring occasionally.
Combine potatoes, sour cream and milk.
Add beef to mixture; season with salt and pepper.
Spoon into prepared casserole; sprinkle with cheese.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until slightly puffed and cheese is melted.

text: <TITLE_START> Buffalo Chicken Calzone<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup buffalo wing sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 refrigerated pizza dough<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 410 degrees f .<INSTR_NEXT> grease a pizza pan.<INSTR_NEXT> place chicken into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.<INSTR_NEXT> cook the chicken breasts until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees f .<INSTR_NEXT> transfer chicken to a bowl and shred with two forks.<INSTR_NEXT> melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and stir chicken and buffalo wing sauce in the hot butter until chicken is coated and heated through, 2 to 4 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> turn pizza dough out onto a generously floured surface.<INSTR_NEXT> roll dough into a 12-inch round.<INSTR_NEXT> brush dough with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and spread 1 cup mozzarella cheese in the center of the dough, leaving a 1-inch border.<INSTR_NEXT> spread chicken mixture over cheese; top chicken mixture with remaining 1 cup cheese.<INSTR_NEXT> fold pizza dough in half and pinch edges together to seal.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer calzone to prepared pizza pan and brush top with remaining 1 tablespoon oil.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 17 to 20 minutes.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 410 degrees f .
Grease a pizza pan.
Place chicken into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
Cook the chicken breasts until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees f .
Transfer chicken to a bowl and shred with two forks.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook and stir chicken and buffalo wing sauce in the hot butter until chicken is coated and heated through, 2 to 4 minutes.
Turn pizza dough out onto a generously floured surface.
Roll dough into a 12-inch round.
Brush dough with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and spread 1 cup mozzarella cheese in the center of the dough, leaving a 1-inch border.
Spread chicken mixture over cheese; top chicken mixture with remaining 1 cup cheese.
Fold pizza dough in half and pinch edges together to seal.
Transfer calzone to prepared pizza pan and brush top with remaining 1 tablespoon oil.
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 17 to 20 minutes.
output: Preheat oven to 410 degrees f . Grease a pizza pan. Place chicken into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Cook the chicken breasts until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees f . Transfer chicken to a bowl and shred with two forks. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir chicken and buffalo wing sauce in the hot butter until chicken is coated and heated through, 2 to 4 minutes. Turn pizza dough out onto a generously floured surface. Roll dough into a 12-inch round. Brush dough with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and spread 1 cup mozzarella cheese in the center of the dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Spread chicken mixture over cheese; top chicken mixture with remaining 1 cup cheese. Fold pizza dough in half and pinch edges together to seal. Transfer calzone to prepared pizza pan and brush top with remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 17 to 20 minutes.

text: <TITLE_START> Italian Lover's Cream Cake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cups sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 cups shortening<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup margarine<INGR_NEXT> 5 egg yolks<INGR_NEXT> 5 egg whites<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups coconut<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon vanilla<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup buttermilk<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups flour<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup pecans<INGR_END><INSTR_START> for layer cake, use three 9" round pans.<INSTR_NEXT> place greased paper in bottom of pans.<INSTR_NEXT> beat sugar, shortening and margarine until fluffy.<INSTR_NEXT> add egg yolks and vanilla; beat well.<INSTR_NEXT> combine flour, soda & salt in a separate bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> add alternately dry ingredients and buttermilk.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in coconut and pecans.<INSTR_NEXT> beat egg whites until stiff, fold into mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> frosting: beat 1/2 c margarine, 8 oz.<INSTR_NEXT> cream cheese and 1 tsp vanilla.<INSTR_NEXT> add one box confectioners sugar, a little bit at a time, then add 1 tsp vanilla.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: For layer cake, use three 9" round pans.
Place greased paper in bottom of pans.
Beat sugar, shortening and margarine until fluffy.
Add egg yolks and vanilla; beat well.
Combine flour, soda & salt in a separate bowl.
Add alternately dry ingredients and buttermilk.
Stir in coconut and pecans.
Beat egg whites until stiff, fold into mixture.
Bake in 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes.
Frosting: beat 1/2 c margarine, 8 oz.
Cream cheese and 1 tsp vanilla.
Add one box confectioners sugar, a little bit at a time, then add 1 tsp vanilla.
output: For layer cake, use three 9" round pans. Place greased paper in bottom of pans. Beat sugar, shortening and margarine until fluffy. Add egg yolks and vanilla; beat well. Combine flour, soda & salt in a separate bowl. Add alternately dry ingredients and buttermilk. Stir in coconut and pecans. Beat egg whites until stiff, fold into mixture. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes. Frosting: beat 1/2 c margarine, 8 oz. Cream cheese and 1 tsp vanilla. Add one box confectioners sugar, a little bit at a time, then add 1 tsp vanilla.

text: <TITLE_START> Tropical Lush<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup flour<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cups powdered sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 stick butter<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups pecans, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons water or as needed<INGR_NEXT> 8 ounces, weight cream cheese, softened<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup powdered sugar<INGR_NEXT> 15 ounces, weight can crushed pineapple<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups cool whip<INGR_NEXT> 15 ounces, fluid coconut milk<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups milk<INGR_NEXT> 2 boxes vanilla cook and serve pudding<INGR_NEXT> 1- 1/2 cup sweetened coconut<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups cool whip<INGR_NEXT> toasted coconut<INGR_NEXT> chopped nuts<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350 degrees f.<INSTR_NEXT> for the crust: cut flour and powdered sugar with butter till it resembles coarse corn meal.<INSTR_NEXT> add chopped pecans and combine.<INSTR_NEXT> pat crust into lightly greased 13x9 baking dish and bake for 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> for the cream cheese layer: combine softened cream cheese with powdered sugar until creamed.<INSTR_NEXT> fold in crushed pineapple and cool whip until just combined.<INSTR_NEXT> spread onto cooled crust.<INSTR_NEXT> for the coconut filling layer: combine coconut milk and milk in large saucepot and follow directions for cook and serve pudding.<INSTR_NEXT> cool pudding mixture and add shredded coconut.<INSTR_NEXT> when completely cool spread onto cream cheese layer.<INSTR_NEXT> to finish, spread cool whip on coconut filling layer and decorate with toasted coconut and chopped nuts as desired.<INSTR_NEXT> refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.<INSTR_END>

output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350 degrees f.
For the crust: cut flour and powdered sugar with butter till it resembles coarse corn meal.
Add chopped pecans and combine.
Pat crust into lightly greased 13x9 baking dish and bake for 15 minutes.
For the cream cheese layer: combine softened cream cheese with powdered sugar until creamed.
Fold in crushed pineapple and cool whip until just combined.
Spread onto cooled crust.
For the coconut filling layer: combine coconut milk and milk in large saucepot and follow directions for cook and serve pudding.
Cool pudding mixture and add shredded coconut.
When completely cool spread onto cream cheese layer.
To finish, spread cool whip on coconut filling layer and decorate with toasted coconut and chopped nuts as desired.
Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.

text: <TITLE_START> Schnitzel With Mushroom Sauce<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 13 cup all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon salt and pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 lb pork cutlets or 1 lb turkey cutlets or 1 lb chicken cutlet<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups white mushrooms or 3 cups cremini mushrooms<INGR_NEXT> 2 cloves garlic, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1 13 cups chicken stock<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup light sour cream<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon soy sauce<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley<INGR_END><INSTR_START> combine flour, salt and pepper in a shallow dish, and press cutlet into flour mixture and turn to coat.<INSTR_NEXT> reserve remaining flour mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> in skillet, melt butter over medium high heat; fry cutlet in batches and turning once, until a hint of pink remeains inside for pork cutlet, about 6 minutes .<INSTR_NEXT> transfer to plate and keep warm.<INSTR_NEXT> in same skillet, fry mushrooms and garlic until no liquid remains about 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add reserved flour mixture cook, stirring for approximately 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in stock; bring to a boil and then reduce heat and simmer, stirring, until thickened, about 3 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add sour cream and soy sauce and stir for about 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> pour over schnitzel and sprinkle with parsley.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Paula Deen's Mccall's Plantation Shrimp Salad<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 lbs shrimp, cleaned and de-veined<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon shrimp seasoning<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup rice<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup chopped onion<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup chopped green olives<INGR_NEXT> black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup mayonnaise<INGR_END><INSTR_START> boil shrimp in water, to cover, with shrimp seasoning just until pink.<INSTR_NEXT> drain and reserve the shrimp boil water.<INSTR_NEXT> chop shrimp into bite-size chunks, put on paper towels; set aside to cool.<INSTR_NEXT> in the reserved water, boil the rice according to package instructions until tender, drain and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> add the onion, olives, and black pepper, to taste, to the rice.<INSTR_NEXT> then stir in the mayonnaise.<INSTR_NEXT> add the cooled, dry shrimp last.<INSTR_NEXT> toss and serve.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Thai Swordfish Salad in Lettuce Cups<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 1/2 pounds swordfish steaks, 1-inch thick<INGR_NEXT> 24 kaffir lime leaves, fresh or dried*<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons thai fish sauce *<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon honey<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon sambal<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup canola oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 lime, juiced, plus 1 lime, juiced<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon thai green curry paste*<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup canned unsweetened coconut milk**<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup hand shredded fresh mint leaves<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup hand shredded fresh cilantro<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup chopped peanuts, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon black sesame seeds, divided<INGR_NEXT> 8 large butter lettuce leaves<INGR_NEXT> 2 thai red chilies, diced<INGR_NEXT> 2 shallots, cut in rings and fried<INGR_NEXT> 4 wooden skewers, soaked in water for 1 hour<INGR_NEXT> *available at asian markets and in the asian foods section of most supermarkets nationwide.<INGR_NEXT> **available at indian markets, asian markets, latin american markets and many supermarkets.<INGR_END><INSTR_START> cut the swordfish into 2-inch cubes and thread onto the skewers, alternating with the lime leaves.<INSTR_NEXT> lay the kebobs in a shallow non-aluminum pan.<INSTR_NEXT> in a bowl, whisk together fish sauce, honey, sambal, oil, and the juice of 1 lime.<INSTR_NEXT> pour the marinade over the swordfish and let marinate for 1 hour.<INSTR_NEXT> heat a ridged grill pan until very hot.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the swordfish skewers from the marinade and grill about 4 minutes per side.<INSTR_NEXT> take care not to overcook so the fish remains moist.<INSTR_NEXT> in a mixing bowl, whisk together curry paste, coconut milk, remaining lime juice, mint, cilantro, 2 tablespoons peanuts, and 1/2 tablespoon sesame seeds.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the swordfish from the skewers and break up in bite-sized pieces; discard lime leaves.<INSTR_NEXT> toss the swordfish in the curry mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> to eat, spoon the swordfish chunks into a lettuce leaf and top with remaining peanuts, sesame seeds, diced chiles and fried shallots.<INSTR_END>
input: Thai Swordfish Salad in Lettuce Cups
ingredients: 24 kaffir lime leaves, fresh or dried*
1/4 cup hand shredded fresh mint leaves
2 shallots, cut in rings and fried
4 wooden skewers, soaked in water for 1 hour
*available at asian markets and in the asian foods section of most supermarkets nationwide.
**available at indian markets, asian markets, latin american markets and many supermarkets.
output_sentences: Cut the swordfish into 2-inch cubes and thread onto the skewers, alternating with the lime leaves.
Lay the kebobs in a shallow non-aluminum pan.
In a bowl, whisk together fish sauce, honey, sambal, oil, and the juice of 1 lime.
Pour the marinade over the swordfish and let marinate for 1 hour.
Heat a ridged grill pan until very hot.
Remove the swordfish skewers from the marinade and grill about 4 minutes per side.
Take care not to overcook so the fish remains moist.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together curry paste, coconut milk, remaining lime juice, mint, cilantro, 2 tablespoons peanuts, and 1/2 tablespoon sesame seeds.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove the swordfish from the skewers and break up in bite-sized pieces; discard lime leaves.
Toss the swordfish in the curry mixture.
To eat, spoon the swordfish chunks into a lettuce leaf and top with remaining peanuts, sesame seeds, diced chiles and fried shallots.

text: <TITLE_START> Scalloped Oysters<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 quart shucked oysters in their liquor<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups coarsely crushed saltine crackers<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup dry bread crumbs<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 cups melted butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup cream<INGR_NEXT> 1 pinch fresh nutmeg to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1 pinch celery salt, to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1 pinch salt and pepper, to taste<INGR_END><INSTR_START> pick oysters free of any shells.<INSTR_NEXT> mix together crackers, bread crumbs, and melted butter.<INSTR_NEXT> in a deep, buttered casserole dish, place a thin layer of the cracker crumb butter mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> cover it with half of the oysters.<INSTR_NEXT> season the cream with the nutmeg, celery salt, salt, and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> pour half of this over the oyster layer.<INSTR_NEXT> on the next layer, place the rest of the oysters, and then 3/4 of the remaining cracker mix.<INSTR_NEXT> cover with the balance of the seasoned cream and the last of the cracker mix.<INSTR_NEXT> bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.<INSTR_NEXT> if you have a choice of what type of oysters to buy, get the smallest in size.<INSTR_NEXT> if the oysters are large , cut them up.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 quart shucked oysters in their liquor
1 pinch salt and pepper, to taste
output_sentences: Pick oysters free of any shells.
Mix together crackers, bread crumbs, and melted butter.
In a deep, buttered casserole dish, place a thin layer of the cracker crumb butter mixture.
Cover it with half of the oysters.
Season the cream with the nutmeg, celery salt, salt, and pepper.
Pour half of this over the oyster layer.
On the next layer, place the rest of the oysters, and then 3/4 of the remaining cracker mix.
Cover with the balance of the seasoned cream and the last of the cracker mix.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.
If you have a choice of what type of oysters to buy, get the smallest in size.
If the oysters are large , cut them up.
output: Pick oysters free of any shells. Mix together crackers, bread crumbs, and melted butter. In a deep, buttered casserole dish, place a thin layer of the cracker crumb butter mixture. Cover it with half of the oysters. Season the cream with the nutmeg, celery salt, salt, and pepper. Pour half of this over the oyster layer. On the next layer, place the rest of the oysters, and then 3/4 of the remaining cracker mix. Cover with the balance of the seasoned cream and the last of the cracker mix. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. If you have a choice of what type of oysters to buy, get the smallest in size. If the oysters are large , cut them up.
output_sentences_v1: If you have a choice of what type of oysters to buy, get the smallest in size.
Mix together crackers, bread crumbs, and melted butter.
On the next layer, place the rest of the oysters, and then 3/4 of the remaining cracker mix.
Cover it with half of the oysters.
If the oysters are large , cut them up.

Bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.

text: <TITLE_START> Velvet Chicken Satays with Fresh Cilantro Chutney<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 1/2 cups lightly packed fresh cilantro<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup lightly packed fresh mint leaves<INGR_NEXT> 5 tablespoons water<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 tablespoons white wine vinegar<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon curry powder<INGR_NEXT> 1 large garlic clove<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons dry white wine<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon low-sodium soy sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon cornstarch<INGR_NEXT> 2 large garlic cloves, pressed<INGR_NEXT> 1 large egg white<INGR_NEXT> 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, well trimmed, cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch-wide strips<INGR_NEXT> 16 wooden skewers<INGR_NEXT> sesame seeds<INGR_END><INSTR_START> process first 8 ingredients in blender until herbs are chopped.<INSTR_NEXT> season to taste with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> (can be made 1 day ahead.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and chill.)<INSTR_NEXT> whisk first 5 ingredients together in medium bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> add chicken and toss to coat.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and refrigerate approximately 2 hours.<INSTR_NEXT> preheat oven to 350f.<INSTR_NEXT> thread chicken onto skewers.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer to baking sheet.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle chicken with sesame seeds.<INSTR_NEXT> bake until chicken is just cooked through, 10 to 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> arrange on platter and serve with chutney.<INSTR_END>
input: Velvet Chicken Satays with Fresh Cilantro Chutney
ingredients: 1 cup lightly packed fresh mint leaves
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon low-sodium soy sauce
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, well trimmed, cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch-wide strips

Bake until chicken is just cooked through, 10 to 15 minutes.
Arrange on platter and serve with chutney.

text: <TITLE_START> A Healthy Carrot Cake Recipe for Memorial Day<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 cups blanched almond flour<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons celtic sea salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 5 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup agave nectar<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup grapeseed oil<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups carrots, grated<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup raisins<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup walnuts<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a large bowl, combine almond flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg.<INSTR_NEXT> in a separate bowl, mix together eggs, agave and oil.<INSTR_NEXT> stir carrots, raisins and walnuts into wet ingredients.<INSTR_NEXT> stir wet ingredients into dry.<INSTR_NEXT> place batter into 2 well greased, round 9 inch cake pans.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 325 degrees for 35 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> cool to room temperature and spread with coconut frosting.<INSTR_END>
input: A Healthy Carrot Cake Recipe for Memorial Day
output_sentences: In a large bowl, combine almond flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg.
In a separate bowl, mix together eggs, agave and oil.
Stir carrots, raisins and walnuts into wet ingredients.
Stir wet ingredients into dry.
Place batter into 2 well greased, round 9 inch cake pans.
Bake at 325 degrees for 35 minutes.
Cool to room temperature and spread with coconut frosting.

text: <TITLE_START> Crunchy Caramel Corn<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 10 cups popped popcorn<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup unsalted butter<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup light corn syrup<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon vanilla<INGR_END><INSTR_START> place popped corn in a large greased roasting pan to keep warm in a 300 degree oven.<INSTR_NEXT> using two half teaspoon measuring spoons, measure about 1/4 tsp of baking soda and about 1/4 tsp of vanilla and set by the side of the stove so they don't spill.<INSTR_NEXT> in a saucepan, stir together brown sugar, butter, and corn syrup on medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and stir to boiling and then cook and stir over medium heat for an additional 4 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> be sure to scrape the bottom often to avoid burning.<INSTR_NEXT> (for those candy makers out there, you're looking for 255, hard-ball stage.<INSTR_NEXT> remove saucepan from heat, stir in baking soda and vanilla, and pour over popcorn.<INSTR_NEXT> stir gently to coat.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in a 300 degree oven for 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> bake 5 minutes more.<INSTR_NEXT> pour out popcorn onto a large piece of foil to cool.<INSTR_NEXT> cool completely before storing in an airtight container or eat it before its all the way cool.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Farmers Market Spaghetti with Beet Balls<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 whole red beet, peeled<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups chickpeas<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups walnuts<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons tahini sauce<INGR_NEXT> 2 whole scallions<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoons garlic powder<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoons cumin<INGR_NEXT> salt and pepper, to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 pounds thick spaghetti<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 clove garlic, peeled and minced<INGR_NEXT> 2 whole carrots, julienned<INGR_NEXT> 2 whole zucchini, julienned<INGR_NEXT> shaved parmesan<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 375 degrees f.<INSTR_NEXT> add beet, chickpeas, walnuts, tahini sauce, scallions, garlic powder and cumin to a food processor and puree until thoroughly combined.<INSTR_NEXT> season to taste.<INSTR_NEXT> form 1-ounce balls and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.<INSTR_NEXT> bake for 30 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> cook pasta in salted boiling water according to package directions.<INSTR_NEXT> while pasta is cooking, heat olive oil and butter in a large saute pan.<INSTR_NEXT> add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, being careful not to burn it.<INSTR_NEXT> add julienned carrots and zucchini and toss together, cooking for an additional minute.<INSTR_NEXT> add the cooked drained pasta and toss to combine.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with the beet balls and some shaved parmesan cheese if desired.<INSTR_END>
input: Farmers Market Spaghetti with Beet Balls
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 375 degrees f.
Add beet, chickpeas, walnuts, tahini sauce, scallions, garlic powder and cumin to a food processor and puree until thoroughly combined.
Season to taste.
Form 1-ounce balls and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cook pasta in salted boiling water according to package directions.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil and butter in a large saute pan.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, being careful not to burn it.
Add julienned carrots and zucchini and toss together, cooking for an additional minute.
Add the cooked drained pasta and toss to combine.
Serve with the beet balls and some shaved parmesan cheese if desired.

While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil and butter in a large saute pan. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, being careful not to burn it. Add julienned carrots and zucchini and toss together, cooking for an additional minute. Add the cooked drained pasta and toss to combine. Serve with the beet balls and some shaved parmesan cheese if desired.

text: <TITLE_START> Healthy Low-Fat Banana French Toast<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 egg whites<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup mashed ripe banana<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup skim milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 teaspoons melted reduced fat margarine<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon vanilla<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon banana extract<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons whole wheat flour<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 4 -6 slices whole wheat bread, best if stale<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat a greased griddle or frying pan .<INSTR_NEXT> puree the mashed banana, milk, vanilla, and banana flavour until the banana is completely smooth with no lumps.<INSTR_NEXT> add melted margarine and egg whites and pulse until completely incorporated.<INSTR_NEXT> sift the next 3 ingredients in a small bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer wet ingredients into a larger bowl, and whisk dry ingredients into wets, and ignore small flour lumps.<INSTR_NEXT> note: be sure to whisk batter before dipping each batch of toast.<INSTR_NEXT> also, dont add any extra banana or milk to the batter .<INSTR_NEXT> dip each side of the toast in the batter for a couple of seconds, and allow some of the excess batter to drip off.<INSTR_NEXT> (for the last piece of bread you will likely have to swab up the remaining batter.<INSTR_NEXT> don't worry if the toast tears, just stick it back together on the frying pan).<INSTR_NEXT> cook each side just over a minute, or until browned to your desired colour.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with lots of maple syrup.<INSTR_NEXT> refrigerate the leftovers and put them in the toaster the next day.<INSTR_NEXT> or cool on a cooking cooling rack, and when completely cool, wrap in foil and freeze.<INSTR_NEXT> warm in microwave then toast and enjoy!<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 4 -6 slices whole wheat bread, best if stale
output_sentences: Preheat a greased griddle or frying pan .
Puree the mashed banana, milk, vanilla, and banana flavour until the banana is completely smooth with no lumps.
Add melted margarine and egg whites and pulse until completely incorporated.
Sift the next 3 ingredients in a small bowl.
Transfer wet ingredients into a larger bowl, and whisk dry ingredients into wets, and ignore small flour lumps.
Note: be sure to whisk batter before dipping each batch of toast.
Also, dont add any extra banana or milk to the batter .
Dip each side of the toast in the batter for a couple of seconds, and allow some of the excess batter to drip off.
(for the last piece of bread you will likely have to swab up the remaining batter.
Don't worry if the toast tears, just stick it back together on the frying pan).
Cook each side just over a minute, or until browned to your desired colour.
Serve with lots of maple syrup.
Refrigerate the leftovers and put them in the toaster the next day.
Or cool on a cooking cooling rack, and when completely cool, wrap in foil and freeze.
Warm in microwave then toast and enjoy!
output: Preheat a greased griddle or frying pan . Puree the mashed banana, milk, vanilla, and banana flavour until the banana is completely smooth with no lumps. Add melted margarine and egg whites and pulse until completely incorporated. Sift the next 3 ingredients in a small bowl. Transfer wet ingredients into a larger bowl, and whisk dry ingredients into wets, and ignore small flour lumps. Note: be sure to whisk batter before dipping each batch of toast. Also, dont add any extra banana or milk to the batter . Dip each side of the toast in the batter for a couple of seconds, and allow some of the excess batter to drip off. (for the last piece of bread you will likely have to swab up the remaining batter. Don't worry if the toast tears, just stick it back together on the frying pan). Cook each side just over a minute, or until browned to your desired colour. Serve with lots of maple syrup. Refrigerate the leftovers and put them in the toaster the next day. Or cool on a cooking cooling rack, and when completely cool, wrap in foil and freeze. Warm in microwave then toast and enjoy!

text: <TITLE_START> Carrot Cake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup canola oil<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup unsweetened applesauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup white sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons baking powder<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon allspice<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups carrots, grated see step 5<INGR_NEXT> 8 ounces crushed pineapple, drained thoroughly and dried with paper towel<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup pecans, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup butter, softened<INGR_NEXT> 8 ounces cream cheese, softened<INGR_NEXT> 3 12 cups confectioners' sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup pecans, chopped<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350 degrees f .<INSTR_NEXT> grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl, beat together eggs, oil, applesauce, brown sugar, white sugar and 1 tablespoon vanilla.<INSTR_NEXT> mix in flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, allspice if using, nutmeg, and cinnamon.<INSTR_NEXT> grate the carrots with the large grater side so that you don't end up with a bunch of carrot mush and juice that can't be used.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in carrots and pineapple.<INSTR_NEXT> fold in pecans.<INSTR_NEXT> pour into prepared pan.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.<INSTR_NEXT> let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.<INSTR_NEXT> to make frosting: in a medium bowl, combine butter, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla.<INSTR_NEXT> beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in chopped pecans.<INSTR_NEXT> frost the cooled cake.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 8 ounces crushed pineapple, drained thoroughly and dried with paper towel
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350 degrees f .
Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.
In a large bowl, beat together eggs, oil, applesauce, brown sugar, white sugar and 1 tablespoon vanilla.
Mix in flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, allspice if using, nutmeg, and cinnamon.
Grate the carrots with the large grater side so that you don't end up with a bunch of carrot mush and juice that can't be used.
Stir in carrots and pineapple.
Fold in pecans.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.
To make frosting: in a medium bowl, combine butter, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Stir in chopped pecans.
Frost the cooled cake.

Grate the carrots with the large grater side so that you don't end up with a bunch of carrot mush and juice that can't be used. Stir in carrots and pineapple. Fold in pecans. Pour into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely. To make frosting: in a medium bowl, combine butter, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Stir in chopped pecans. Frost the cooled cake.

text: <TITLE_START> Hot Chocolate Fudge<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 34 whole hot cocoa with marshmallow flavored 3 musketeers bars , unwrapped<INGR_NEXT> 1 can sweetened condensed milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 bag ghirardelli milk chocolate chips<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cups plus 1 tablespoon jet-puffed marshmallow bits<INGR_END><INSTR_START> chop the 3 musketeers into smaller pieces.<INSTR_NEXT> i chopped mine into 6 pieces each.<INSTR_NEXT> in a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the condensed milk, the chocolate chips, and half of the chopped 3 musketeers.<INSTR_NEXT> heat and stir until all of the chocolate is completely melted and the mixture is almost smooth .<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat, stir in the vanilla, the other half of the chopped 3 musketeers, and 1/2 cup of the marshmallow bits until completely combined.<INSTR_NEXT> then spread the mixture evenly into a parchment paper lined 8 x 8 pan or glass dish .<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle the top with the remaining tablespoon of mallow bits.<INSTR_NEXT> place the container in the fridge and chill until set .<INSTR_NEXT> remove dish from fridge and gently lift the parchment paper to remove the fudge from the pan .<INSTR_NEXT> slice and serve.<INSTR_END>

output_sentences: Chop the 3 musketeers into smaller pieces.

Slice and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Heavenly Chocolate Cheesecake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cups vanilla wafers, crushed<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup toasted almonds, ground<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup butter<INGR_NEXT> margarine, melted<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups toll house milk chocolate morsels<INGR_NEXT> 1 pkg. unflavored gelatin<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 lb. cream cheese, softened<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup sour cream<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tsp. almond extract<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup whipping cream, whipped<INGR_END><INSTR_START> for crust: in medium bowl, combine crumbs, almonds, sugar and butter; mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> press firmly onto bottom and 2-inches up sides of a 9-inch springform pan.<INSTR_NEXT> for filling: in small, heavy saucepan over low heat, melt morsels, stirring frequently.<INSTR_NEXT> in small saucepan, sprinkle gelatin over milk; let stand for 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> warm over low heat, stirring frequently, until gelatin is dissolved.<INSTR_NEXT> in large mixer bowl, beat cream cheese, sour cream and chocolate until fluffy.<INSTR_NEXT> beat in gelatin mixture and almond extract.<INSTR_NEXT> fold in whipped cream; pour into crust.<INSTR_NEXT> chill about 3 hours or until firm.<INSTR_NEXT> run knife around edge of cheesecake; remove rim.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish as desired.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 2 cups toll house milk chocolate morsels
output_sentences: For crust: in medium bowl, combine crumbs, almonds, sugar and butter; mix well.
Press firmly onto bottom and 2-inches up sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
For filling: in small, heavy saucepan over low heat, melt morsels, stirring frequently.
In small saucepan, sprinkle gelatin over milk; let stand for 1 minute.
Warm over low heat, stirring frequently, until gelatin is dissolved.
In large mixer bowl, beat cream cheese, sour cream and chocolate until fluffy.
Beat in gelatin mixture and almond extract.
Fold in whipped cream; pour into crust.
Chill about 3 hours or until firm.
Run knife around edge of cheesecake; remove rim.
Garnish as desired.

text: <TITLE_START> Bacon Wrapped Caprese Chicken With Mushrooms<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 6 whole chicken breasts<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 log mozzarella cheese<INGR_NEXT> 3 whole tomatoes, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 bunch basil leaves<INGR_NEXT> 1 pound bacon<INGR_NEXT> 10 whole button mushrooms<INGR_END><INSTR_START> prepare your oven to 400 degrees f.<INSTR_NEXT> butterfly chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper, then lay out individually.<INSTR_NEXT> stuffed chicken with cut mozzarella, tomatoes and basil leaves.<INSTR_NEXT> after stuffing, close chicken breasts and wrap individual bacon pieces around each one.<INSTR_NEXT> lay in a casserole dish.<INSTR_NEXT> add mushrooms around chicken breasts and bake for 1 hour or until chicken is cooked through.<INSTR_END>

output_sentences: Prepare your oven to 400 degrees f.
Butterfly chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper, then lay out individually.
Stuffed chicken with cut mozzarella, tomatoes and basil leaves.

text: <TITLE_START> Delaware Baked Eggs<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup cheese grated sharp<INGR_NEXT> 4 large eggs<INGR_NEXT> 4 dash red hot pepper sauce<INGR_NEXT> 4 dash worcestershire sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup ketchup<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup light cream<INGR_NEXT> 4 slices bread toasted and buttered<INGR_END><INSTR_START> put butter into a baking dish that is at least 2 inches deep.<INSTR_NEXT> warm dish long enough to melt butter.<INSTR_NEXT> cool dish so eggs will not set but butter will remain liquid.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle one half of cheese over butter.<INSTR_NEXT> break eggs into 4 separate spaces, far enough apart so they will not run into each other.<INSTR_NEXT> put dashes of hot pepper sauce and worcestershire in center of each egg yolk.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon ketchup over yolks.<INSTR_NEXT> pour in cream.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle remaining cheese over eggs.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in moderate oven 350f f until eggs are set.<INSTR_NEXT> serve each egg on a slice of buttered toast and spoon the pan sauces over it.<INSTR_END>

Break eggs into 4 separate spaces, far enough apart so they will not run into each other.

text: <TITLE_START> Homemade Goat Cheese<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 gallons raw goat's milk<INGR_NEXT> 38 ounces, weight yogourmet yogurt starter<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a large saucepan, heat milk to 110 degrees, stirring constantly.<INSTR_NEXT> once it reaches temperature, pour milk into a blender, then add yogurt starter and blend on high for 10 seconds.<INSTR_NEXT> blending the milk removes any clumps that the yogurt starter may form.<INSTR_NEXT> pour milk into yogourmet yogurt maker and turn machine on.<INSTR_NEXT> leave yogurt in machine for 12 hours, longer is ok too.<INSTR_NEXT> line a colander with cheese cloth and place the colander over a bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> pour yogurt into cheesecloth lined colander and allow to drain for 8 hours in refrigerator.<INSTR_NEXT> lift cheese cloth off of colander and the scrape creamy cheese off onto a plate.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer creamy cheese into a 2 cup mason jar.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with crackers!<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: In a large saucepan, heat milk to 110 degrees, stirring constantly.
Once it reaches temperature, pour milk into a blender, then add yogurt starter and blend on high for 10 seconds.
Blending the milk removes any clumps that the yogurt starter may form.
Pour milk into yogourmet yogurt maker and turn machine on.
Leave yogurt in machine for 12 hours, longer is ok too.
Line a colander with cheese cloth and place the colander over a bowl.
Pour yogurt into cheesecloth lined colander and allow to drain for 8 hours in refrigerator.
Lift cheese cloth off of colander and the scrape creamy cheese off onto a plate.
Transfer creamy cheese into a 2 cup mason jar.
Serve with crackers!

text: <TITLE_START> Roasted Asparagus Shiitake Salad<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 cloves garlic, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1 lb asparagus, cut into 2 inch pieces<INGR_NEXT> salt<INGR_NEXT> pepper<INGR_NEXT> 14 lb shiitake mushroom caps<INGR_NEXT> 1 small red onion, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 23 cup cherry tomatoes, halved<INGR_NEXT> 1 red pepper, roasted and sliced<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup olive oil, plus extra for drizzling on asparagus<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350.<INSTR_NEXT> toss garlic with asparagus and shiitakes and place on a roasting pan, roast for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> remove to a bowl and cool completely.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion, peppers, tomatoes.<INSTR_NEXT> whisk together vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper, drizzle over salad, toss, serve.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 lb asparagus, cut into 2 inch pieces
13 cup olive oil, plus extra for drizzling on asparagus
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350.
Toss garlic with asparagus and shiitakes and place on a roasting pan, roast for 5 minutes.
Remove to a bowl and cool completely.
Add onion, peppers, tomatoes.
Whisk together vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper, drizzle over salad, toss, serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Egg-White Crepes<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 cup whole wheat flour<INGR_NEXT> 2 egg whites<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup skim milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 pinch salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup mixed frozen berries, thawed and drained<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar for dusting<INGR_END><INSTR_START> whisk together the wheat flour, egg whites, milk, salt, and oil in a large bowl until smooth.<INSTR_NEXT> lightly coat a skillet with cooking spray and place over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> pour 1/4 cup of the batter into the skillet.<INSTR_NEXT> tilt the pan in a circular motion to allow the batter to spread to the edges.<INSTR_NEXT> cook until the bottom is light brown, about 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> flip the crepe and place 2 tablespoons of the mixed berries in the center of the crepe; cook another 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> fold the crepe in half and remove with a spatula to a serving plate.<INSTR_NEXT> dust with confectioners' sugar and serve.<INSTR_END>

output_sentences: Whisk together the wheat flour, egg whites, milk, salt, and oil in a large bowl until smooth.

Tilt the pan in a circular motion to allow the batter to spread to the edges.
Cook until the bottom is light brown, about 2 minutes.
Flip the crepe and place 2 tablespoons of the mixed berries in the center of the crepe; cook another 2 minutes.
Fold the crepe in half and remove with a spatula to a serving plate.
Dust with confectioners' sugar and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Emeril's Cajun Chicks<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon zatarains concentrated shrimp and crab boil<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup apple cider<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 cup honey<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 -ounce bottle abita amber beer<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon ground allspice<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup creole seasoning<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoon cayenne<INGR_NEXT> pinch ground cloves<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon cayenne<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 whole roasting chickens<INGR_END><INSTR_START> to make the marinade, combine all of the ingredients in a food processor or blender.<INSTR_NEXT> process for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> fill a syringe with the marinade and inject each chicken breast, back, wings and legs.<INSTR_NEXT> you will have to fill the syringe several times.<INSTR_NEXT> next, combine the seasoning ingredients and rub the mixture evenly over each chicken.<INSTR_NEXT> place them in large plastic bags, seal and refrigerate for 24 hours.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from the refrigerator and place on a spit.<INSTR_NEXT> place the spit over the fire.<INSTR_NEXT> slow cook the chickens over the fire for about 4 hours or until the chickens are golden brown and the juices run clear.<INSTR_NEXT> the internal temperature of the chickens should reach 170 to 180 degrees on an instant read thermometer.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the chickens from the spit and transfer to large platters.<INSTR_NEXT> allow the chickens to rest for 10<INSTR_END>

Next, combine the seasoning ingredients and rub the mixture evenly over each chicken.
