text: <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Raisin Soft Pretzels<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 ounce active dry yeast<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 cups warm water<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups cake flour<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup raisins<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups hot water<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons butter, melted<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water, stir in brown sugar and salt -- add cake flour and stir well.<INSTR_NEXT> add enough all purpose flour to form a soft dough.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in raisins, turn onto floured surface.<INSTR_NEXT> knead till smooth -- about 6-8 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> place in a greased bowl, turn to grease top.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and let rise at least 40 minutes --<INSTR_NEXT> punch dough down.divide into 14 balls.<INSTR_NEXT> roll each ball into a 15" long rope.<INSTR_NEXT> dissolve baking soda in hot water --<INSTR_NEXT> dip each rope in baking soda water and drain on paper towels.<INSTR_NEXT> form into pretzel shapes, place on greased sheets.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 400* for 15 minutes --<INSTR_NEXT> combine 3/4 cup sugar and 1 tsp ground cinnamon, brush pretzels with the three tablespoons of butter and dip in cinnamon sugar mixture.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: In large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water, stir in brown sugar and salt -- add cake flour and stir well.
Add enough all purpose flour to form a soft dough.
Stir in raisins, turn onto floured surface.
Knead till smooth -- about 6-8 minutes.
Place in a greased bowl, turn to grease top.
Cover and let rise at least 40 minutes --
Punch dough down.divide into 14 balls.
Roll each ball into a 15" long rope.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water --
Dip each rope in baking soda water and drain on paper towels.
Form into pretzel shapes, place on greased sheets.
Bake at 400* for 15 minutes --
Combine 3/4 cup sugar and 1 tsp ground cinnamon, brush pretzels with the three tablespoons of butter and dip in cinnamon sugar mixture.
output: In large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water, stir in brown sugar and salt -- add cake flour and stir well. Add enough all purpose flour to form a soft dough. Stir in raisins, turn onto floured surface. Knead till smooth -- about 6-8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turn to grease top. Cover and let rise at least 40 minutes -- Punch dough down.divide into 14 balls. Roll each ball into a 15" long rope. Dissolve baking soda in hot water -- Dip each rope in baking soda water and drain on paper towels. Form into pretzel shapes, place on greased sheets. Bake at 400* for 15 minutes -- Combine 3/4 cup sugar and 1 tsp ground cinnamon, brush pretzels with the three tablespoons of butter and dip in cinnamon sugar mixture.

text: <TITLE_START> Pepperoncini Firecrackers<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 jar pepperoncini peppers<INGR_NEXT> 12 lb boneless skinless chicken breast, cooked and cut into 24 pieces<INGR_NEXT> 24 pieces monterey jack cheese or 24 pieces monterey jack pepper cheese<INGR_NEXT> 24 sheets phyllo dough<INGR_NEXT> pam cooking spray, butter-flavored spray<INGR_NEXT> melted butter<INGR_NEXT> 48 fresh chives<INGR_END><INSTR_START> remove 24 pepperoncinis from jar; remove and discard stems and seeds.<INSTR_NEXT> drain peppers on paper towels.<INSTR_NEXT> stuff each with a piece of chicken and a cheese strip .<INSTR_NEXT> place one sheet of phyllo dough on a work surface .<INSTR_NEXT> spritz dough with butter-flavored spray.<INSTR_NEXT> repeat three times; stack sprayed phyllo dough.<INSTR_NEXT> cut stacks into four pieces, about 6-1/2 inches x 4-1/4 inches each.<INSTR_NEXT> center one stuffed pepper on one long side of each phyllo stack; roll up and twist the ends to seal.<INSTR_NEXT> repeat with remaining peppers and dough.<INSTR_NEXT> place on ungreased baking sheets.<INSTR_NEXT> drizzle butter over center of firecrackers.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 375 for 18-22 minutes or until golden brown.<INSTR_NEXT> tie ends with chives.<INSTR_NEXT> yield: 2 dozen.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Old Fashioned Oatmeal with Caramelized Apples<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cooking apples, peeled, cored, and cut into 1/4-inch dice<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cups dark brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 teaspoons ground cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter<INGR_NEXT> pinch of salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups old fashioned oats<INGR_NEXT> 3- 1/2 cups water<INGR_NEXT> pinch of salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract<INGR_END><INSTR_START> for the caramelized apples: place apples, dark brown sugar, cinnamon, butter, and salt in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> stir constantly until the apples are tender and well coated with the sauce that forms in the pan, about 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat and stir in vanilla.<INSTR_NEXT> reserve until needed.<INSTR_NEXT> for the oatmeal: in a medium saucepan, combine the old fashioned oats, water, and salt.<INSTR_NEXT> cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat and stir in vanilla.<INSTR_NEXT> divide oatmeal into bowls and top each with caramelized apples.<INSTR_END>
input: Old Fashioned Oatmeal with Caramelized Apples
ingredients: 2 cooking apples, peeled, cored, and cut into 1/4-inch dice
output_sentences: For the caramelized apples: place apples, dark brown sugar, cinnamon, butter, and salt in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
Stir constantly until the apples are tender and well coated with the sauce that forms in the pan, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Reserve until needed.
For the oatmeal: in a medium saucepan, combine the old fashioned oats, water, and salt.
Cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Divide oatmeal into bowls and top each with caramelized apples.

text: <TITLE_START> Chicken Tortilla Soup II<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup carrot, diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup celery<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup onion, diced<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon garlic powder or 1 fresh diced garlic clove<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon corn oil<INGR_NEXT> 4 cans chicken broth<INGR_NEXT> 1 can tomatoes, diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 can rotel tomatoes & chilies, diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 packet taco seasoning, i use mccormicks<INGR_NEXT> 10 corn tortillas<INGR_NEXT> 12 ounces chicken meat, poached, diced<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup milk or 1 cup sour cream<INGR_NEXT> 12 ounces monterey jack cheese or 12 ounces mexican blend cheese, shredded<INGR_NEXT> corn tortilla chips, broken into small pieces for garnish<INGR_END><INSTR_START> saute carrots, onions, celery in corn oil, garlic, salt and pepper until tender.<INSTR_NEXT> add chicken broth and bring to boil.<INSTR_NEXT> add tomatoes, rotel, taco seasoning, and chicken.<INSTR_NEXT> cut tortillas into small pieces and add to broth mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> let boil for 20 minutes or until tortillas are thoroughly incorporated into soup stirring occasionally to keep from sticking.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce heat and add 8 oz.<INSTR_NEXT> simmer for additional 10 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add milk and simmer for additional 10 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> if thicker soup is desired, add more diced tortillas and let incorporate into soup.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish with shredded cheese and broken tortilla chips.<INSTR_NEXT> substitutions: 1 cup masa harina for 1 10 ct. package of corn tortillas.<INSTR_NEXT> gradually add masa flour mixing into broth, mixing thoroughly into broth.<INSTR_NEXT> if thicker soup is desired, add more masa flour.<INSTR_NEXT> you can also use grilled chicken fajita meat for poached diced chicken.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 12 teaspoon garlic powder or 1 fresh diced garlic clove
1 packet taco seasoning, i use mccormicks
1 cup milk or 1 cup sour cream
12 ounces monterey jack cheese or 12 ounces mexican blend cheese, shredded
Corn tortilla chips, broken into small pieces for garnish
output_sentences: Saute carrots, onions, celery in corn oil, garlic, salt and pepper until tender.
Add chicken broth and bring to boil.
Add tomatoes, rotel, taco seasoning, and chicken.
Cut tortillas into small pieces and add to broth mixture.
Let boil for 20 minutes or until tortillas are thoroughly incorporated into soup stirring occasionally to keep from sticking.
Reduce heat and add 8 oz.
Simmer for additional 10 minutes.
Add milk and simmer for additional 10 minutes.
If thicker soup is desired, add more diced tortillas and let incorporate into soup.
Garnish with shredded cheese and broken tortilla chips.
Substitutions: 1 cup masa harina for 1 10 ct. package of corn tortillas.
Gradually add masa flour mixing into broth, mixing thoroughly into broth.
If thicker soup is desired, add more masa flour.
You can also use grilled chicken fajita meat for poached diced chicken.

text: <TITLE_START> Johnny Cakes<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 12 cups flour<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup cornmeal<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon baking powder<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus some for frying<INGR_NEXT> 34 cup water<INGR_END><INSTR_START> place first five ingredients in a bowl and whisk to combine.<INSTR_NEXT> make a well in the centre and slowly ad the oil and then the water.<INSTR_NEXT> gently mix until a lose dough forms.<INSTR_NEXT> turn gently on to a very lightly floured surface and gently knead in to a ball.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and let rest for 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> shape the dough into a long roll, about 2-3 inches wide; cut into 18 even pieces.<INSTR_NEXT> shape each piece in to a small ball and then flatten into 1 1/2 inch thick disk.<INSTR_NEXT> place a large skillet over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan.<INSTR_NEXT> when the oil is hot, fry the johnny cakes in batches for 2-3 min per side, or until puffed and golden.<INSTR_NEXT> dry on paper towels and serve.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus some for frying
output_sentences: Place first five ingredients in a bowl and whisk to combine.
Make a well in the centre and slowly ad the oil and then the water.
Gently mix until a lose dough forms.
Turn gently on to a very lightly floured surface and gently knead in to a ball.
Cover and let rest for 15 minutes.
Shape the dough into a long roll, about 2-3 inches wide; cut into 18 even pieces.
Shape each piece in to a small ball and then flatten into 1 1/2 inch thick disk.
Place a large skillet over medium heat.
Add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan.
When the oil is hot, fry the johnny cakes in batches for 2-3 min per side, or until puffed and golden.
Dry on paper towels and serve.
output: Place first five ingredients in a bowl and whisk to combine. Make a well in the centre and slowly ad the oil and then the water. Gently mix until a lose dough forms. Turn gently on to a very lightly floured surface and gently knead in to a ball. Cover and let rest for 15 minutes. Shape the dough into a long roll, about 2-3 inches wide; cut into 18 even pieces. Shape each piece in to a small ball and then flatten into 1 1/2 inch thick disk. Place a large skillet over medium heat. Add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan. When the oil is hot, fry the johnny cakes in batches for 2-3 min per side, or until puffed and golden. Dry on paper towels and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Chicken Baked With Orange Spiced Harissa Sauce<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 14 cup harissa<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup orange juice<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon grated orange peel<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup cider vinegar<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 3 lbs chicken<INGR_END><INSTR_START> combine all ingredients except chicken to make a smooth sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> thin with orange juice if needed.<INSTR_NEXT> separate skin from chicken breast being careful not to cut the skin.<INSTR_NEXT> place some of the sauce between breast skin and breast.<INSTR_NEXT> cover chicken with the remainder of the sauce and marinate 3-4 hours in the refrigerator.<INSTR_NEXT> bake chicken in a 350 f oven for two hours until done basting frequently with sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> cover chicken with aluminum foil if chicken browns too soon.<INSTR_END>
input: Chicken Baked With Orange Spiced Harissa Sauce
output_sentences: Combine all ingredients except chicken to make a smooth sauce.
Thin with orange juice if needed.
Separate skin from chicken breast being careful not to cut the skin.
Place some of the sauce between breast skin and breast.
Cover chicken with the remainder of the sauce and marinate 3-4 hours in the refrigerator.
Bake chicken in a 350 f oven for two hours until done basting frequently with sauce.
Cover chicken with aluminum foil if chicken browns too soon.

output_shuffled_2: Bake chicken in a 350 f oven for two hours until done basting frequently with sauce. Cover chicken with aluminum foil if chicken browns too soon. Cover chicken with the remainder of the sauce and marinate 3-4 hours in the refrigerator. Place some of the sauce between breast skin and breast. Thin with orange juice if needed. Separate skin from chicken breast being careful not to cut the skin. Combine all ingredients except chicken to make a smooth sauce.

text: <TITLE_START> Sweet-Salty Simmered Chicken Wings with Ginger<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 8 chicken drumettes - the first joint of a chicken wing<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp soy sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp to 3 tbsp sake<INGR_NEXT> 3 tbsp plus sugar<INGR_NEXT> 3 tbsp soy sauce<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tsp salt<INGR_NEXT> 100 ml water<INGR_NEXT> 1 tsp grated ginger<INGR_NEXT> 1 pinch dashi stock granules<INGR_END><INSTR_START> pan fry the chicken wings first.<INSTR_NEXT> heat oil in a frying pan, and fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides.<INSTR_NEXT> i added some green peppers this time too.<INSTR_NEXT> while the chicken is cooking, mix the sauce ingredients together.<INSTR_NEXT> add the mixture when the chicken turns golden brown.<INSTR_NEXT> cover with a lid and steam-cook for about 10 minutes over low heat.<INSTR_NEXT> when only the 1/2 of the original amount of liquid is left in the pan, remove the lid and flip over the chicken.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce the sauce by half again, and add the soy sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> keep simmering until only a little liquid is left.<INSTR_NEXT> don't let it burn.<INSTR_NEXT> coat the chicken wings with the sauce to finish.<INSTR_END>
input: Sweet-Salty Simmered Chicken Wings with Ginger
ingredients: 8 chicken drumettes - the first joint of a chicken wing
output_sentences: Pan fry the chicken wings first.
Heat oil in a frying pan, and fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides.
I added some green peppers this time too.
While the chicken is cooking, mix the sauce ingredients together.
Add the mixture when the chicken turns golden brown.
Cover with a lid and steam-cook for about 10 minutes over low heat.
When only the 1/2 of the original amount of liquid is left in the pan, remove the lid and flip over the chicken.
Reduce the sauce by half again, and add the soy sauce.
Keep simmering until only a little liquid is left.
Don't let it burn.
Coat the chicken wings with the sauce to finish.
output: Pan fry the chicken wings first. Heat oil in a frying pan, and fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides. I added some green peppers this time too. While the chicken is cooking, mix the sauce ingredients together. Add the mixture when the chicken turns golden brown. Cover with a lid and steam-cook for about 10 minutes over low heat. When only the 1/2 of the original amount of liquid is left in the pan, remove the lid and flip over the chicken. Reduce the sauce by half again, and add the soy sauce. Keep simmering until only a little liquid is left. Don't let it burn. Coat the chicken wings with the sauce to finish.

text: <TITLE_START> Baked Apples with Rum<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 cup dark brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup dark rum<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup water<INGR_NEXT> kosher salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 6 whole cloves<INGR_NEXT> 6 small to medium-size apples, preferably a "sturdy" variety like rome or granny smith, washed and cored<INGR_NEXT> 6 cinnamon sticks<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup apple cider<INGR_NEXT> rum raisin ice cream, optional<INGR_NEXT> sour cream, optional<INGR_END><INSTR_START> these are so satisfying and don't break the calorie bank if eaten without the ice cream.<INSTR_NEXT> they can also be made without the rum.<INSTR_NEXT> i have suggested rum raisin ice cream because i love the combination, but vanilla ice cream or even lemon sorbet would be just as delicious.<INSTR_NEXT> for the glaze: in a medium saucepan, combine the dark brown sugar, rum, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves.<INSTR_NEXT> stir to blend and bring to a simmer over medium heat.<INSTR_NEXT> cook and reduce for 3 to 4 minutes to allow the sugar and other ingredients to blend together.<INSTR_NEXT> prepare the apples: preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. in a baking dish large enough to hold all of the apples, arrange the apples in a single layer.<INSTR_NEXT> put a cinnamon stick inside the cavity made from coring each apple.<INSTR_NEXT> pour the glaze over the apples and top each with pieces of butter.<INSTR_NEXT> add the cider to the bottom of the dish and place it in the center of the oven.<INSTR_NEXT> cook the apples, basting them from time to time, 25 to 30 minutes, or until they are tender but not mushy.<INSTR_NEXT> cook's note: smaller apples will take less time.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with scoops of ice cream or sour cream, if desired or just by themselves.<INSTR_NEXT> they are also delicious leftover.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 6 small to medium-size apples, preferably a "sturdy" variety like rome or granny smith, washed and cored
2 tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces
output_sentences: These are so satisfying and don't break the calorie bank if eaten without the ice cream.
They can also be made without the rum.
I have suggested rum raisin ice cream because i love the combination, but vanilla ice cream or even lemon sorbet would be just as delicious.
For the glaze: in a medium saucepan, combine the dark brown sugar, rum, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves.
Stir to blend and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Cook and reduce for 3 to 4 minutes to allow the sugar and other ingredients to blend together.
Prepare the apples: preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. in a baking dish large enough to hold all of the apples, arrange the apples in a single layer.
Put a cinnamon stick inside the cavity made from coring each apple.
Pour the glaze over the apples and top each with pieces of butter.
Add the cider to the bottom of the dish and place it in the center of the oven.
Cook the apples, basting them from time to time, 25 to 30 minutes, or until they are tender but not mushy.
Cook's note: smaller apples will take less time.
Serve with scoops of ice cream or sour cream, if desired or just by themselves.
They are also delicious leftover.

Add the cider to the bottom of the dish and place it in the center of the oven. Cook the apples, basting them from time to time, 25 to 30 minutes, or until they are tender but not mushy. Cook's note: smaller apples will take less time. Serve with scoops of ice cream or sour cream, if desired or just by themselves. They are also delicious leftover.

text: <TITLE_START> Always need more BBQ potatoes!<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 lb baby yellow potatoes<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 packages bacon<INGR_NEXT> 2 each onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 piece butter slices, one for each package<INGR_NEXT> 1 pam spray<INGR_END><INSTR_START> wash potatoes, cut into bite sized cubes and toss in a bag with your salt and pepper<INSTR_NEXT> each package will need 3 pieces of tin foil.<INSTR_NEXT> make the size comfortable for yourself and your bbq.<INSTR_NEXT> lightly spray the first piece.<INSTR_NEXT> lay down your first layer of potatoes.<INSTR_NEXT> next layer will be onions, just a few, then take 2 pieces of bacon, slice in half and place it on the onions then another layer of potatoes.<INSTR_NEXT> put your slice of butter on top and wrap up your package.<INSTR_NEXT> repeat the step.<INSTR_NEXT> this amount should make 4 packages and you can adjust more or less for your needs.<INSTR_NEXT> this is a very versatile recipe for your needs!<INSTR_NEXT> put on the bbq for 30 mins, turning every 7-8 mins at 400f<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 piece butter slices, one for each package
output_sentences: Wash potatoes, cut into bite sized cubes and toss in a bag with your salt and pepper
Each package will need 3 pieces of tin foil.
Make the size comfortable for yourself and your bbq.
Lightly spray the first piece.
Lay down your first layer of potatoes.
Next layer will be onions, just a few, then take 2 pieces of bacon, slice in half and place it on the onions then another layer of potatoes.
Put your slice of butter on top and wrap up your package.
Repeat the step.
This amount should make 4 packages and you can adjust more or less for your needs.
This is a very versatile recipe for your needs!
Put on the bbq for 30 mins, turning every 7-8 mins at 400f

text: <TITLE_START> Creepy Eyes Crispy Balls<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 3 tbsp. butter or margarine<INGR_NEXT> 1 pkg. jet-puffed marshmallows<INGR_NEXT> 5 cups kelloggs rice krispies cereal<INGR_NEXT> 16 halloween oreo cookies, coarsely chopped<INGR_NEXT> 36 mini oreo bite size cookies<INGR_NEXT> 2 tsp. red decorating gel<INGR_END><INSTR_START> microwave butter in large microwaveable bowl on high 45 sec.<INSTR_NEXT> or until melted.<INSTR_NEXT> add marshmallows; toss to coat.<INSTR_NEXT> microwave 1-1/2 min.<INSTR_NEXT> or until marshmallows are completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring after 45 sec.<INSTR_NEXT> add cereal and chopped cookies; mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> roll into 18 balls.<INSTR_NEXT> use thumb to make 2 indentation in center of each ball.<INSTR_NEXT> split mini oreo cookies in half.<INSTR_NEXT> reserve plain halves for snacking or another use.<INSTR_NEXT> press remaining cookie halves, creme-sides up, into cereal balls for the eyes.<INSTR_NEXT> decorate with gel to resemble bloodshot eyes.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Microwave butter in large microwaveable bowl on high 45 sec.
Or until melted.
Add marshmallows; toss to coat.
Microwave 1-1/2 min.
Or until marshmallows are completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring after 45 sec.
Add cereal and chopped cookies; mix well.
Roll into 18 balls.
Use thumb to make 2 indentation in center of each ball.
Split mini oreo cookies in half.
Reserve plain halves for snacking or another use.
Press remaining cookie halves, creme-sides up, into cereal balls for the eyes.
Decorate with gel to resemble bloodshot eyes.

text: <TITLE_START> Easy Huevos Rancheros<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 18 cups fresh chopped tomatoes<INGR_NEXT> 18 cups chopped white onion<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon roasted, pickled, or fresh chopped jalapeno, or more if desired<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 18 cups water<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon tomato paste<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon garlic powder<INGR_NEXT> salt to taste<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro<INGR_NEXT> 2 whole large eggs<INGR_NEXT> 18 cups mozzarella cheese<INGR_END><INSTR_START> first, add chopped tomatoes, onions, and jalapenos to a warm non-stick skillet with a bit of olive oil over medium high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> allow everything to saute for two minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> then add the water, tomato paste, garlic powder, salt, and cilantro.<INSTR_NEXT> continue to cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until the water and tomato paste form a thick sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> once the sauce is thicker, make a opening in the center and add two eggs unbeaten.<INSTR_NEXT> place in a preheated 400 degrees f oven for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> then add mozzarella cheese along the top.<INSTR_NEXT> place pan back in the oven for 3 more minutes if you want your eggs soft/runny or continue to cook for 10 minutes for a hard yolk.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 tablespoon roasted, pickled, or fresh chopped jalapeno, or more if desired
output_sentences: First, add chopped tomatoes, onions, and jalapenos to a warm non-stick skillet with a bit of olive oil over medium high heat.
Allow everything to saute for two minutes.
Then add the water, tomato paste, garlic powder, salt, and cilantro.
Continue to cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until the water and tomato paste form a thick sauce.
Once the sauce is thicker, make a opening in the center and add two eggs unbeaten.
Place in a preheated 400 degrees f oven for 5 minutes.
Then add mozzarella cheese along the top.
Place pan back in the oven for 3 more minutes if you want your eggs soft/runny or continue to cook for 10 minutes for a hard yolk.

text: <TITLE_START> Hina Doll Rice Balls for Hinamatsuri<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 120 grams hot cooked white rice<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 nori seaweed<INGR_NEXT> 1 dash carrot<INGR_END><INSTR_START> form a triangle shaped rice ball seasoned with salt.<INSTR_NEXT> at the bottom of the rice ball, cross the nori seaweed cut into thin strips and wrap it around the rice ball like a kimono.<INSTR_NEXT> for the hair, stick another nori seaweed on the pointy end of the rice ball while leaving some space on top.<INSTR_NEXT> cut the edges of the nori seaweed to make it easier to wrap.<INSTR_NEXT> wrap the rice balls with a plastic wrap and press the rice balls to let the nori seaweed stick to the rice.<INSTR_NEXT> make the face by sticking on the punched out nori seaweed on the rice balls.<INSTR_NEXT> cut out boiled carrot using a straw to make the cheeks and secure by sticking with uncooked spaghetti.<INSTR_NEXT> you can also decorate them by inserting picks as shown on the photo.<INSTR_NEXT> you're all done.<INSTR_NEXT> petit sized hina dolls are also cute.<INSTR_END>
input: Hina Doll Rice Balls for Hinamatsuri
output_sentences: Form a triangle shaped rice ball seasoned with salt.
At the bottom of the rice ball, cross the nori seaweed cut into thin strips and wrap it around the rice ball like a kimono.
For the hair, stick another nori seaweed on the pointy end of the rice ball while leaving some space on top.
Cut the edges of the nori seaweed to make it easier to wrap.
Wrap the rice balls with a plastic wrap and press the rice balls to let the nori seaweed stick to the rice.
Make the face by sticking on the punched out nori seaweed on the rice balls.
Cut out boiled carrot using a straw to make the cheeks and secure by sticking with uncooked spaghetti.
You can also decorate them by inserting picks as shown on the photo.
You're all done.
Petit sized hina dolls are also cute.

Wrap the rice balls with a plastic wrap and press the rice balls to let the nori seaweed stick to the rice. Make the face by sticking on the punched out nori seaweed on the rice balls. Petit sized hina dolls are also cute.

text: <TITLE_START> Smothered Meatloaf<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 cups o'brien potatoes<INGR_NEXT> 1 lb lean ground beef<INGR_NEXT> 1 14 lbs ground pork<INGR_NEXT> 1 box garlic and herb shake-in-bake<INGR_NEXT> 1 envelope lipton beefy onion soup mix<INGR_NEXT> 1 jar sliced mushrooms, drained<INGR_NEXT> 1 egg<INGR_NEXT> 1 can condensed cheddar cheese soup, divided<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup evaporated milk<INGR_NEXT> 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion, sliced thin<INGR_NEXT> 1 packagesliced fresh mushrooms<INGR_END><INSTR_START> place potatoes in the bottom of a 5-quart slow cooker.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, shake and bake, onion soup mix, sliced mushrooms, and egg.<INSTR_NEXT> in a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup cheddar soup and evaporated milk.<INSTR_NEXT> add to meat mixture.<INSTR_NEXT> using a wooden spoon or clean hands mix thoroughly and form into a loaf.<INSTR_NEXT> place in slow cooker on top of the potatoes.<INSTR_NEXT> make sure meatloaf does not touch the sides of the slow cooker.<INSTR_NEXT> stir together remaining cheddar soup with cream of mushroom soup.<INSTR_NEXT> pour over meatloaf.<INSTR_NEXT> top with onions and mushrooms.<INSTR_NEXT> cover and cook on high setting for 1 hour.<INSTR_NEXT> reduce the temperature to low setting and cook for an additional 5 to 6 hours.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 envelope lipton beefy onion soup mix
1 can condensed cheddar cheese soup, divided
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
output_sentences: Place potatoes in the bottom of a 5-quart slow cooker.
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, shake and bake, onion soup mix, sliced mushrooms, and egg.
In a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup cheddar soup and evaporated milk.
Add to meat mixture.
Using a wooden spoon or clean hands mix thoroughly and form into a loaf.
Place in slow cooker on top of the potatoes.
Make sure meatloaf does not touch the sides of the slow cooker.
Stir together remaining cheddar soup with cream of mushroom soup.
Pour over meatloaf.
Top with onions and mushrooms.
Cover and cook on high setting for 1 hour.
Reduce the temperature to low setting and cook for an additional 5 to 6 hours.
output: Place potatoes in the bottom of a 5-quart slow cooker. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, shake and bake, onion soup mix, sliced mushrooms, and egg. In a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup cheddar soup and evaporated milk. Add to meat mixture. Using a wooden spoon or clean hands mix thoroughly and form into a loaf. Place in slow cooker on top of the potatoes. Make sure meatloaf does not touch the sides of the slow cooker. Stir together remaining cheddar soup with cream of mushroom soup. Pour over meatloaf. Top with onions and mushrooms. Cover and cook on high setting for 1 hour. Reduce the temperature to low setting and cook for an additional 5 to 6 hours.

text: <TITLE_START> A Jad Cucumber Pickle Recipe<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1/2 c. rice vinegar<INGR_NEXT> 5 tbsp. thangkwa<INGR_NEXT> 2 tbsp. hom daeng , finely sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp. nam som paep<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp. haeo , finely sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 tbsp. prik chi fa daeng , sliced<INGR_END><INSTR_START> this pickle is often confused with the similar-in-concept, but functionally quite different, than gkwa kiaowan, a sweet & sour cooked relish.<INSTR_NEXT> slice the cucumber in four lengthwise, then slice the pcs to segments about an eighth of an inch thick.<INSTR_NEXT> slice the tops of the chilis , and tap out any loose seeds, and throw away, then slice the chilis across into thin rounds.<INSTR_NEXT> slice the shallots and water chestnuts.<INSTR_NEXT> combine and serve.<INSTR_NEXT> this will keep 2 or possibly 3 weeks in a referigerator.<INSTR_NEXT> it is a traditional accomaniment to snacks such as spring rolls, or possibly to barbequed foods.<INSTR_END>

output_sentences: This pickle is often confused with the similar-in-concept, but functionally quite different, than gkwa kiaowan, a sweet & sour cooked relish.
Slice the cucumber in four lengthwise, then slice the pcs to segments about an eighth of an inch thick.
Slice the tops of the chilis , and tap out any loose seeds, and throw away, then slice the chilis across into thin rounds.
Slice the shallots and water chestnuts.
Combine and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Roasted Sea Bass with Summer Squash<TITLE_END><INGR_START> two 3-pound whole fish, such as sea bass or snapper, scaled and gutted<INGR_NEXT> salt and freshly ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 sprigs each of thyme, rosemary and dill<INGR_NEXT> 4 plum tomatoes, thinly sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 red onion, thinly sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 small zucchini, thinly sliced<INGR_NEXT> 1 small yellow squash, thinly sliced<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling and serving<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon dried greek oregano<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 tablespoon dijon mustard<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons plain whole-milk greek yogurt or homemade greek yogurt<INGR_NEXT> 2/3 cup mixed chopped dill, mint and parsley<INGR_NEXT> lemon wedges, for serving<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat the oven to 400.<INSTR_NEXT> put the fish in a large roasting pan and season inside and out with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> fill the cavities with the herb sprigs.<INSTR_NEXT> scatter the tomatoes, onion, zucchini and squash over the fish and on the bottom of the roasting pan; season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> generously drizzle the fish and vegetables with olive oil and sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon of the oregano.<INSTR_NEXT> roast for about 45 minutes, stirring the vegetables in the pan a few times, until the fish is just cooked through and the flesh flakes easily with a fork.<INSTR_NEXT> meanwhile, in a bowl, stir the lemon juice with the mustard, the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oregano.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the yogurt and season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer the fish to a work surface.<INSTR_NEXT> scrape the vegetables and pan juices into a bowl and discard the herb sprigs.<INSTR_NEXT> remove the fish fillets from the bones; transfer to plates.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle the vegetables and fish with the chopped herbs.<INSTR_NEXT> pass the ladolemono yogurt at the table and serve with lemon wedges.<INSTR_END>
input: Roasted Sea Bass with Summer Squash
ingredients: Two 3-pound whole fish, such as sea bass or snapper, scaled and gutted
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 sprigs each of thyme, rosemary and dill
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling and serving
2 tablespoons plain whole-milk greek yogurt or homemade greek yogurt
2/3 cup mixed chopped dill, mint and parsley
output_sentences: Preheat the oven to 400.
Put the fish in a large roasting pan and season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Fill the cavities with the herb sprigs.
Scatter the tomatoes, onion, zucchini and squash over the fish and on the bottom of the roasting pan; season with salt and pepper.
Generously drizzle the fish and vegetables with olive oil and sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon of the oregano.
Roast for about 45 minutes, stirring the vegetables in the pan a few times, until the fish is just cooked through and the flesh flakes easily with a fork.
Meanwhile, in a bowl, stir the lemon juice with the mustard, the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oregano.
Stir in the yogurt and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the fish to a work surface.
Scrape the vegetables and pan juices into a bowl and discard the herb sprigs.
Remove the fish fillets from the bones; transfer to plates.
Sprinkle the vegetables and fish with the chopped herbs.
Pass the ladolemono yogurt at the table and serve with lemon wedges.
output: Preheat the oven to 400. Put the fish in a large roasting pan and season inside and out with salt and pepper. Fill the cavities with the herb sprigs. Scatter the tomatoes, onion, zucchini and squash over the fish and on the bottom of the roasting pan; season with salt and pepper. Generously drizzle the fish and vegetables with olive oil and sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon of the oregano. Roast for about 45 minutes, stirring the vegetables in the pan a few times, until the fish is just cooked through and the flesh flakes easily with a fork. Meanwhile, in a bowl, stir the lemon juice with the mustard, the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oregano. Stir in the yogurt and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the fish to a work surface. Scrape the vegetables and pan juices into a bowl and discard the herb sprigs. Remove the fish fillets from the bones; transfer to plates. Sprinkle the vegetables and fish with the chopped herbs. Pass the ladolemono yogurt at the table and serve with lemon wedges.

text: <TITLE_START> Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies (Tom)<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup butter, unsalted 2 sticks, softened<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup sugar white<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup brown sugar, light<INGR_NEXT> 2 large eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 cups pumpkin puree puree<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups flour, all-purpose<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon cinnamon heaping teaspoon<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg ground<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon ginger ground<INGR_NEXT> 2 1/4 cups milk chocolate chips<INGR_END><INSTR_START> heat oven to 350f .<INSTR_NEXT> line two cookie sheets with parchment paper.<INSTR_NEXT> beat the butter in a mixer until smooth.<INSTR_NEXT> beat in the white and brown sugars, until the mixture is lightly and fluffy.<INSTR_NEXT> beat in the eggs, then mix in the vanilla and pumpkin puree.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger.<INSTR_NEXT> slowly beat the flour mixture into the batter in thirds, scraping down the bowl as you go.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the chocolate chips.<INSTR_NEXT> scoop the dough by heaping tablespoons onto the cookie sheets and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cookies are set and browned around the edges.<INSTR_NEXT> let them cool on pan for 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Heat oven to 350f .
Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper.
Beat the butter in a mixer until smooth.
Beat in the white and brown sugars, until the mixture is lightly and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, then mix in the vanilla and pumpkin puree.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger.
Slowly beat the flour mixture into the batter in thirds, scraping down the bowl as you go.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Scoop the dough by heaping tablespoons onto the cookie sheets and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cookies are set and browned around the edges.
Let them cool on pan for 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
output: Heat oven to 350f . Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper. Beat the butter in a mixer until smooth. Beat in the white and brown sugars, until the mixture is lightly and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, then mix in the vanilla and pumpkin puree. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Slowly beat the flour mixture into the batter in thirds, scraping down the bowl as you go. Stir in the chocolate chips. Scoop the dough by heaping tablespoons onto the cookie sheets and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cookies are set and browned around the edges. Let them cool on pan for 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

text: <TITLE_START> Hot Chocolate<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 cup milk<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons powdered chocolate milk mix or 4 tablespoons drinking chocolate<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons strawberry milk mix or 4 tablespoons strawberry-flavor nestle nesquik powder<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 ounces chocolate squares or 1 12 ounces chocolate pieces<INGR_NEXT> 1 ounce miniature marshmallows or 1 ounce marshmallows<INGR_NEXT> 2 gummy rings or 2 gummy bears or 2 gumdrops or 2 licorice twists<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a cup, stir together the milk, drinking chocolate and strawberry milk mix.<INSTR_NEXT> add the chocolate squares, marshmallows and gummy candies to the drink.<INSTR_NEXT> heat in the microwave on medium or medium-low power until the chocolate, marshmallows and candies have melted.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 4 tablespoons powdered chocolate milk mix or 4 tablespoons drinking chocolate
4 tablespoons strawberry milk mix or 4 tablespoons strawberry-flavor nestle nesquik powder
1 12 ounces chocolate squares or 1 12 ounces chocolate pieces
1 ounce miniature marshmallows or 1 ounce marshmallows
2 gummy rings or 2 gummy bears or 2 gumdrops or 2 licorice twists
output_sentences: In a cup, stir together the milk, drinking chocolate and strawberry milk mix.
Add the chocolate squares, marshmallows and gummy candies to the drink.
Heat in the microwave on medium or medium-low power until the chocolate, marshmallows and candies have melted.

text: <TITLE_START> Soft Scrambled Eggs with Romano and Black Pepper with Tomato Bruschetta<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 loaf italian bread<INGR_NEXT> extra-virgin olive oil<INGR_NEXT> kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 3 large ripe tomatoes, roughly chopped<INGR_NEXT> generous handful fresh basil, roughly chopped, plus small leaves for serving<INGR_NEXT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter<INGR_NEXT> 1 dozen large eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 ounces coarsely grated pecorino romano cheese<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat a grill pan over medium heat for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> slice the bread in half the long way.<INSTR_NEXT> brush the cut sides with 2 tablespoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper and grill, cut-side down, until nicely charred.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from the grill to a cutting board.<INSTR_NEXT> while the bread toasts, toss the tomatoes with a bit of olive oil, salt, pepper and the chopped basil.<INSTR_NEXT> mound the mixture on the toasted bread.<INSTR_NEXT> melt the butter in a large nonstick saute pan over low heat.<INSTR_NEXT> crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until light and fluffy with the coarse pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> add the eggs to the skillet and mix gently using a rubber spatula until soft curds form.<INSTR_NEXT> fold in the cheese and remove from the heat.<INSTR_NEXT> spoon the eggs onto 4 dinner plates.<INSTR_NEXT> slice the bruschetta into 4 or 8 pieces and put next to the eggs.<INSTR_NEXT> drizzle some olive oil over the bruschetta and scatter the basil leaves on top.<INSTR_END>
input: Soft Scrambled Eggs with Romano and Black Pepper with Tomato Bruschetta
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Generous handful fresh basil, roughly chopped, plus small leaves for serving
4 ounces coarsely grated pecorino romano cheese
output_sentences: Preheat a grill pan over medium heat for 5 minutes.
Slice the bread in half the long way.
Brush the cut sides with 2 tablespoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper and grill, cut-side down, until nicely charred.
Remove from the grill to a cutting board.
While the bread toasts, toss the tomatoes with a bit of olive oil, salt, pepper and the chopped basil.
Mound the mixture on the toasted bread.
Melt the butter in a large nonstick saute pan over low heat.
Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until light and fluffy with the coarse pepper.
Add the eggs to the skillet and mix gently using a rubber spatula until soft curds form.
Fold in the cheese and remove from the heat.
Spoon the eggs onto 4 dinner plates.
Slice the bruschetta into 4 or 8 pieces and put next to the eggs.
Drizzle some olive oil over the bruschetta and scatter the basil leaves on top.
output: Preheat a grill pan over medium heat for 5 minutes. Slice the bread in half the long way. Brush the cut sides with 2 tablespoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper and grill, cut-side down, until nicely charred. Remove from the grill to a cutting board. While the bread toasts, toss the tomatoes with a bit of olive oil, salt, pepper and the chopped basil. Mound the mixture on the toasted bread. Melt the butter in a large nonstick saute pan over low heat. Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until light and fluffy with the coarse pepper. Add the eggs to the skillet and mix gently using a rubber spatula until soft curds form. Fold in the cheese and remove from the heat. Spoon the eggs onto 4 dinner plates. Slice the bruschetta into 4 or 8 pieces and put next to the eggs. Drizzle some olive oil over the bruschetta and scatter the basil leaves on top.

Spoon the eggs onto 4 dinner plates.

text: <TITLE_START> Sardinian Pasta with Tomato Basil<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 6 quarts water<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 pound pasta<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons olive oil, extra-virgin<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup italian plum tomatoes<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon black pepper ground<INGR_NEXT> 6 each basil torn<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon butter<INGR_END><INSTR_START> bring water to a boil and add salt.<INSTR_NEXT> add pasta to the water and cook at a boil for 30 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> while pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a sauce pot and add the tomatoes over low heat.<INSTR_NEXT> season the tomatoes with salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes before adding the basil leaves.<INSTR_NEXT> cook for an additional 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> drain the pasta in a colander and pour into a serving bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> stir butter into the tomato sauce and immediately add to cooked pasta.<INSTR_NEXT> stir well to fully coat the pasta.<INSTR_NEXT> serve the chicken over a bed of pasta.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Bring water to a boil and add salt.
Add pasta to the water and cook at a boil for 30 minutes.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a sauce pot and add the tomatoes over low heat.
Season the tomatoes with salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes before adding the basil leaves.

Drain the pasta in a colander and pour into a serving bowl.
Stir butter into the tomato sauce and immediately add to cooked pasta.
Stir well to fully coat the pasta.
Serve the chicken over a bed of pasta.

text: <TITLE_START> Nacho Popcorn<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 8 cups popcorn, warm<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon dried chives<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon lime zest or 12 teaspoon lemon zest, finely grated<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon ground cumin<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon chili powder<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon pepper<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup monterey jack cheese or 13 cup cheddar cheese, finely grated<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 300f.<INSTR_NEXT> spread popcorn out evenly on a rimmed baking sheet and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> combine butter, chives , zest, cumin and chili powder in a bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> microwave on medium until butter is melted .<INSTR_NEXT> stir well then drizzle mixture evenly over popcorn and toss well.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle with salt and pepper, then stir well.<INSTR_NEXT> spread out in an even layer.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle cheese evenly over top.<INSTR_NEXT> bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is evenly melted.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 12 teaspoon lime zest or 12 teaspoon lemon zest, finely grated
13 cup monterey jack cheese or 13 cup cheddar cheese, finely grated
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 300f.
Spread popcorn out evenly on a rimmed baking sheet and set aside.
Combine butter, chives , zest, cumin and chili powder in a bowl.
Microwave on medium until butter is melted .
Stir well then drizzle mixture evenly over popcorn and toss well.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper, then stir well.
Spread out in an even layer.
Sprinkle cheese evenly over top.
Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is evenly melted.

text: <TITLE_START> Iced Oatmeal Applesauce Cookies (Martha Stewart)<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup packed light-brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup granulated sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 egg<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup chunky applesauce<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 cups old fashioned oats<INGR_NEXT> 1 14 cups all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon baking powder<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup raisins<INGR_NEXT> confectioners' sugar<INGR_NEXT> pure maple syrup<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350 degrees.<INSTR_NEXT> mix the butter and both sugars until combined.<INSTR_NEXT> add the egg and applesauce, mixing until well blended .<INSTR_NEXT> mix in oats, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.<INSTR_NEXT> fold in raisins.<INSTR_NEXT> using a 1 1/2-inch ice cream scoop, drop dough onto baking sheets lined with parchment paper, spacing 2 inches apart.<INSTR_NEXT> bake cookies until golden, 13 to 15 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> let cool on sheets 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer cookies to a wire rack set over parchment paper; let cool completely.<INSTR_NEXT> to make icing: whisk confectioners' sugar, syrup, and 3 tablespoons water until smooth.<INSTR_NEXT> drizzle over cookies, let set.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix the butter and both sugars until combined.
Add the egg and applesauce, mixing until well blended .
Mix in oats, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Fold in raisins.
Using a 1 1/2-inch ice cream scoop, drop dough onto baking sheets lined with parchment paper, spacing 2 inches apart.
Bake cookies until golden, 13 to 15 minutes.
Let cool on sheets 5 minutes.
Transfer cookies to a wire rack set over parchment paper; let cool completely.
To make icing: whisk confectioners' sugar, syrup, and 3 tablespoons water until smooth.
Drizzle over cookies, let set.
output: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the butter and both sugars until combined. Add the egg and applesauce, mixing until well blended . Mix in oats, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Fold in raisins. Using a 1 1/2-inch ice cream scoop, drop dough onto baking sheets lined with parchment paper, spacing 2 inches apart. Bake cookies until golden, 13 to 15 minutes. Let cool on sheets 5 minutes. Transfer cookies to a wire rack set over parchment paper; let cool completely. To make icing: whisk confectioners' sugar, syrup, and 3 tablespoons water until smooth. Drizzle over cookies, let set.
output_sentences_v1: To make icing: whisk confectioners' sugar, syrup, and 3 tablespoons water until smooth.

text: <TITLE_START> Best of Best Apple Pie<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 12 lbs rome apples, pared, quarterd, cored and thinly sliced<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup light brown sugar, firmly packed<INGR_NEXT> 13 cup sugar, granulated<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon cornstarch or 2 tablespoons flour<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon ground nutmeg<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 18 inches pie crusts<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> water or milk<INGR_NEXT> sugar, for sprinkling<INGR_END><INSTR_START> place apples in a large bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> mix sugars, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt in a small bowl; sprinkle dry mixture over apples; toss gently, to mix.<INSTR_NEXT> let stand until a little juice forms, at least 10 minutes or more.<INSTR_NEXT> prepare pie crust of your choice.<INSTR_NEXT> pile apple mixture into pastry; dot with butter<INSTR_NEXT> place second crust over the apples, and crimp.<INSTR_NEXT> brush with water or milk if desired.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle with sugar if desired.<INSTR_NEXT> bake pie at 425 for 40 minutes or until juices bubble through slits and apples are tender.<INSTR_NEXT> if edges are browning too fast cover wth a narrow strip of foil.<INSTR_END>

text: <TITLE_START> Rainforest Brittle<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cups granulated sugar<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup corn syrup<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons butter<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon vanilla<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon baking soda<INGR_NEXT> 23 cup brazil nut<INGR_NEXT> 23 cup cashews<INGR_NEXT> 23 cup macadamia nuts<INGR_END><INSTR_START> .coarsely chop or halved the nuts.<INSTR_NEXT> in large heavy saucepan, stir together sugar, corn syrup and water.<INSTR_NEXT> bring to boil over medium heat; cook, without stirring but brushing down side of pan with pastry brush dipped in cold water, for about 10 minutes or until candy thermometer reaches 234f , or soft-ball stage when 1 tsp hot syrup dropped into cold water forms soft, pliable ball.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in butter and salt cook for about 10 minutes or until 300f , or hard-crack stage when 1 tsp hot syrup dropped into cold water forms hard brittle threads.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from heat.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in vanilla.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in baking soda.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in brazil, cashew and macadamia nuts.<INSTR_NEXT> immediately pour onto greased baking sheet.<INSTR_NEXT> using greased spatula, spread thinly over pan.<INSTR_NEXT> let brittle cool.<INSTR_NEXT> break into pieces.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: .coarsely chop or halved the nuts.
In large heavy saucepan, stir together sugar, corn syrup and water.

Bring to boil over medium heat; cook, without stirring but brushing down side of pan with pastry brush dipped in cold water, for about 10 minutes or until candy thermometer reaches 234f , or soft-ball stage when 1 tsp hot syrup dropped into cold water forms soft, pliable ball.
Stir in butter and salt cook for about 10 minutes or until 300f , or hard-crack stage when 1 tsp hot syrup dropped into cold water forms hard brittle threads.
Remove from heat.
Stir in vanilla.
Stir in baking soda.
Stir in brazil, cashew and macadamia nuts.
Immediately pour onto greased baking sheet.
Using greased spatula, spread thinly over pan.
Let brittle cool.
Break into pieces.

Bring to boil over medium heat; cook, without stirring but brushing down side of pan with pastry brush dipped in cold water, for about 10 minutes or until candy thermometer reaches 234f , or soft-ball stage when 1 tsp hot syrup dropped into cold water forms soft, pliable ball. Remove from heat. .coarsely chop or halved the nuts.

text: <TITLE_START> Spicy Filet Mignon With Grilled Sweet Onion<TITLE_END><INGR_START> cooking spray<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups vidalia onions or 2 cups other sweet onion, sliced<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 18 teaspoon black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon garlic powder<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon ground cumin<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon dried oregano<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon ground red pepper<INGR_NEXT> 14 teaspoon black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 filet mignon<INGR_END><INSTR_START> heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> coat pan with cooking spray.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion; sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> cook 8 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally.<INSTR_NEXT> remove from pan; keep warm.<INSTR_NEXT> combine garlic powder and next 5 ingredients in a small bowl; sprinkle this mixture over both sides of beef.<INSTR_NEXT> add beef to pan; grill 5 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness.<INSTR_NEXT> serve topped with grilled onions.<INSTR_END>
input: Spicy Filet Mignon With Grilled Sweet Onion
ingredients: 2 cups vidalia onions or 2 cups other sweet onion, sliced
output_sentences: Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.
Add onion; sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper.
Cook 8 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally.
Remove from pan; keep warm.
Combine garlic powder and next 5 ingredients in a small bowl; sprinkle this mixture over both sides of beef.
Add beef to pan; grill 5 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness.
Serve topped with grilled onions.

text: <TITLE_START> Luscious Lemon Cake<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 4 eggs<INGR_NEXT> 1 package instant lemon pudding mix<INGR_NEXT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 package lemon cake mix<INGR_NEXT> 3/4 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 cup lemon juice<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups sifted confectioners' sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar for dusting<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350 degrees f .<INSTR_NEXT> grease and flour a bundt or tube pan.<INSTR_NEXT> beat eggs until thick.<INSTR_NEXT> add pudding mix, cake mix, water, and oil; beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> pour batter into prepared pan.<INSTR_NEXT> bake for 50 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> in the last 5 minutes of baking, prepare the glaze.<INSTR_NEXT> mix lemon juice and 3 cups confectioner's sugar in a saucepan.<INSTR_NEXT> heat to boiling.<INSTR_NEXT> pour hot glaze over hot cake, and let cool for approximately 1 hour.<INSTR_NEXT> carefully invert cake onto serving platter.<INSTR_NEXT> finish with a light dusting of confectioners sugar.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350 degrees f .
Grease and flour a bundt or tube pan.
Beat eggs until thick.
Add pudding mix, cake mix, water, and oil; beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 5 minutes.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 50 minutes.
In the last 5 minutes of baking, prepare the glaze.
Mix lemon juice and 3 cups confectioner's sugar in a saucepan.
Heat to boiling.
Pour hot glaze over hot cake, and let cool for approximately 1 hour.
Carefully invert cake onto serving platter.
Finish with a light dusting of confectioners sugar.

text: <TITLE_START> Apple Creamy<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 cans apple pie filling<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups half-and-half<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups ginger ale<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup brown sugar, packed<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup apple cider<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons apple cider<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon apple pie spice<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup cool whip, thawed<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons brown sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons sugar<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon butter, melted<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons walnuts, finely chopped<INGR_NEXT> 12 teaspoon cinnamon<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a blender, blend pie filling till smooth.<INSTR_NEXT> in a large pan, combine apple pie filling, half and half, ginger ale, one cup cider, brown sugar and apple pie spice; mix well.<INSTR_NEXT> simmer over low heat till mixture is steamy, but do not boil!<INSTR_NEXT> mix whipped topping with 2 tablespoons apple cider and set aside.<INSTR_NEXT> to prepare streusel topping:.<INSTR_NEXT> in small bowl, combine brown sugar, sugar, walnuts and cinnamon.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in butter and blend till mixture is crumbly.<INSTR_NEXT> pour apple creamy into mugs.<INSTR_NEXT> top with serving of cool whip and a sprinkle of streusel topping.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: In a blender, blend pie filling till smooth.
In a large pan, combine apple pie filling, half and half, ginger ale, one cup cider, brown sugar and apple pie spice; mix well.
Simmer over low heat till mixture is steamy, but do not boil!
Mix whipped topping with 2 tablespoons apple cider and set aside.
To prepare streusel topping:.
In small bowl, combine brown sugar, sugar, walnuts and cinnamon.
Stir in butter and blend till mixture is crumbly.
Pour apple creamy into mugs.
Top with serving of cool whip and a sprinkle of streusel topping.

text: <TITLE_START> Baked Rice with Butternut Squash<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 butternut squash<INGR_NEXT> 2 cups fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup water<INGR_NEXT> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh or 1 teaspoon dried rubbed sage<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup diced onion<INGR_NEXT> 2 garlic cloves, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup uncooked arborio or other short-grain rice<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup dry white wine<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon chopped fresh or 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme<INGR_NEXT> 1/2 teaspoon salt<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 teaspoon black pepper<INGR_NEXT> cooking spray<INGR_NEXT> 1/4 cup grated fresh parmesan cheese<INGR_NEXT> fresh thyme sprigs<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 350.place squash on a baking sheet.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until tender; cool.<INSTR_NEXT> peel squash; cut in half lengthwise.<INSTR_NEXT> discard seeds and membranes; cut into 1/2-inch cubes.<INSTR_NEXT> increase oven temperature to 400.bring broth, water, and sage to a simmer in a medium saucepan .<INSTR_NEXT> heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> add onion; saute 6 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add garlic; saute 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add rice; saute 1 minute.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in squash, broth mixture, wine, chopped thyme, salt, and pepper; cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.place rice mixture in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.<INSTR_NEXT> bake at 400 for 30 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> stir mixture gently.<INSTR_NEXT> sprinkle with cheese; bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts.<INSTR_NEXT> garnish with fresh thyme sprigs, if desired.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh or 1 teaspoon dried rubbed sage
1 cup uncooked arborio or other short-grain rice
1 teaspoon chopped fresh or 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 350.place squash on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until tender; cool.
Peel squash; cut in half lengthwise.
Discard seeds and membranes; cut into 1/2-inch cubes.
Increase oven temperature to 400.bring broth, water, and sage to a simmer in a medium saucepan .
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion; saute 6 minutes.
Add garlic; saute 2 minutes.
Add rice; saute 1 minute.
Stir in squash, broth mixture, wine, chopped thyme, salt, and pepper; cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.place rice mixture in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.
Bake at 400 for 30 minutes.
Stir mixture gently.
Sprinkle with cheese; bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts.
Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs, if desired.

Discard seeds and membranes; cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Increase oven temperature to 400.bring broth, water, and sage to a simmer in a medium saucepan . Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; saute 6 minutes. Add garlic; saute 2 minutes. Add rice; saute 1 minute. Stir in squash, broth mixture, wine, chopped thyme, salt, and pepper; cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.place rice mixture in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 30 minutes. Stir mixture gently. Sprinkle with cheese; bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs, if desired.

text: <TITLE_START> Toblerone Pear Tart<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 frozen sweet short crust flan, thawed<INGR_NEXT> 125g philadelphia spreadable cream cheese<INGR_NEXT> 100g toblerone* milk chocolate, melted<INGR_NEXT> 1 egg<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons sugar<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons sr flour<INGR_NEXT> 440g can pear halves<INGR_NEXT> 50g dark chocolate, melted<INGR_NEXT> cream for serving<INGR_END><INSTR_START> prick pastry all over with a fork then bake at 200c for 5-8 minutes or until just starting to colour.<INSTR_NEXT> allow to cool.<INSTR_NEXT> combine together the philly* and chocolate and beat until smooth, stir through the egg and flour.<INSTR_NEXT> place the pears into the pastry base, and then pour over the chocolate filling.<INSTR_NEXT> bake in a moderate oven at 180c for 20-30 minutes or until the filling is set.<INSTR_NEXT> serve slices drizzled with dark chocolate and a dollop of cream.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 frozen sweet short crust flan, thawed
output_sentences: Prick pastry all over with a fork then bake at 200c for 5-8 minutes or until just starting to colour.
Allow to cool.
Combine together the philly* and chocolate and beat until smooth, stir through the egg and flour.
Place the pears into the pastry base, and then pour over the chocolate filling.
Bake in a moderate oven at 180c for 20-30 minutes or until the filling is set.
Serve slices drizzled with dark chocolate and a dollop of cream.
output: Prick pastry all over with a fork then bake at 200c for 5-8 minutes or until just starting to colour. Allow to cool. Combine together the philly* and chocolate and beat until smooth, stir through the egg and flour. Place the pears into the pastry base, and then pour over the chocolate filling. Bake in a moderate oven at 180c for 20-30 minutes or until the filling is set. Serve slices drizzled with dark chocolate and a dollop of cream.

text: <TITLE_START> Buttermilk Fried Chicken With a Curry Flair<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 12 cups buttermilk<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons curry powder<INGR_NEXT> 3 34 teaspoons kosher salt, divided<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 teaspoons ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 3 whole chicken legs, cut into leg and thigh pieces<INGR_NEXT> 6 chicken breast halves, with skin and bones<INGR_NEXT> 1 12 cups all-purpose flour<INGR_NEXT> 2 teaspoons chili powder<INGR_NEXT> 3 cups about canola oil<INGR_END><INSTR_START> mix buttermilk, curry powder, 3 teaspoons salt and pepper in large bowl; add chicken; turn to coat; cover; chill at least 4 hours, but overnight is recommended.<INSTR_NEXT> remove chicken from refrigerator; line 2 baking sheets with paper towels; mix flour, chili powder and 3/4 teaspoon salt in shallow dish.<INSTR_NEXT> add enough canola oil to 12-inch skillet to reach depth of 1/2 inch; heat over medium-high heat to 375f.<INSTR_NEXT> remove 6 chicken pieces from buttermilk mixture; dip in flour mixture and turn to coat; shake off excess.<INSTR_NEXT> add chicken, skin side down, to skillet; reduce heat to medium-low; cover, cook until brown, about 12 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> turn chicken over; cook uncovered until cooked through, about 5 minutes for breasts and 10 minutes for legs and thighs; transfer to paper towels.<INSTR_NEXT> repeat with remaining chicken.<INSTR_END>
input: Buttermilk Fried Chicken With a Curry Flair
ingredients: 3 whole chicken legs, cut into leg and thigh pieces
6 chicken breast halves, with skin and bones
output_sentences: Mix buttermilk, curry powder, 3 teaspoons salt and pepper in large bowl; add chicken; turn to coat; cover; chill at least 4 hours, but overnight is recommended.
Remove chicken from refrigerator; line 2 baking sheets with paper towels; mix flour, chili powder and 3/4 teaspoon salt in shallow dish.
Add enough canola oil to 12-inch skillet to reach depth of 1/2 inch; heat over medium-high heat to 375f.
Remove 6 chicken pieces from buttermilk mixture; dip in flour mixture and turn to coat; shake off excess.
Add chicken, skin side down, to skillet; reduce heat to medium-low; cover, cook until brown, about 12 minutes.
Turn chicken over; cook uncovered until cooked through, about 5 minutes for breasts and 10 minutes for legs and thighs; transfer to paper towels.
Repeat with remaining chicken.
output: Mix buttermilk, curry powder, 3 teaspoons salt and pepper in large bowl; add chicken; turn to coat; cover; chill at least 4 hours, but overnight is recommended. Remove chicken from refrigerator; line 2 baking sheets with paper towels; mix flour, chili powder and 3/4 teaspoon salt in shallow dish. Add enough canola oil to 12-inch skillet to reach depth of 1/2 inch; heat over medium-high heat to 375f. Remove 6 chicken pieces from buttermilk mixture; dip in flour mixture and turn to coat; shake off excess. Add chicken, skin side down, to skillet; reduce heat to medium-low; cover, cook until brown, about 12 minutes. Turn chicken over; cook uncovered until cooked through, about 5 minutes for breasts and 10 minutes for legs and thighs; transfer to paper towels. Repeat with remaining chicken.

text: <TITLE_START> Bacon and Parmesan Penne Pasta<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb bacon, coarsely chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 4 garlic cloves, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes<INGR_NEXT> 1 lb dry penne pasta<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup grated parmesan cheese<INGR_END><INSTR_START> place the chopped bacon and onion in a skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir until the bacon is crisp and the onion is beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and cook another 2 - 3 minutes, being careful not to burn the garlic.<INSTR_NEXT> while the bacon and onion are cooking, fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat.<INSTR_NEXT> once the water is boiling, stir in the penne, and return to a boil.<INSTR_NEXT> cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 11 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> drain pasta, transfer to a large serving bowl, and stir in the olive oil to coat the pasta.<INSTR_NEXT> drain the bacon grease from the skillet, leaving a couple of tablespoons or to taste.<INSTR_NEXT> stir the cooked bacon mixture into the pasta, and sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the pasta.<INSTR_NEXT> stir to mix in the cheese, and serve.<INSTR_END>
output_sentences: Place the chopped bacon and onion in a skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir until the bacon is crisp and the onion is beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and cook another 2 - 3 minutes, being careful not to burn the garlic.
While the bacon and onion are cooking, fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat.
Once the water is boiling, stir in the penne, and return to a boil.
Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 11 minutes.
Drain pasta, transfer to a large serving bowl, and stir in the olive oil to coat the pasta.
Drain the bacon grease from the skillet, leaving a couple of tablespoons or to taste.
Stir the cooked bacon mixture into the pasta, and sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the pasta.
Stir to mix in the cheese, and serve.
output: Place the chopped bacon and onion in a skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir until the bacon is crisp and the onion is beginning to brown, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and cook another 2 - 3 minutes, being careful not to burn the garlic. While the bacon and onion are cooking, fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, stir in the penne, and return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 11 minutes. Drain pasta, transfer to a large serving bowl, and stir in the olive oil to coat the pasta. Drain the bacon grease from the skillet, leaving a couple of tablespoons or to taste. Stir the cooked bacon mixture into the pasta, and sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the pasta. Stir to mix in the cheese, and serve.

text: <TITLE_START> Adobo Pork Chops<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 2 tablespoons canola oil<INGR_NEXT> 1 small white onion, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 2 garlic cloves, chopped<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 ounces dried guajillo chiles, stemmed, seeded and cut into 2-inch pieces<INGR_NEXT> 1 1/2 cups low-sodium chicken broth<INGR_NEXT> pinch of sugar<INGR_NEXT> kosher salt<INGR_NEXT> pepper<INGR_NEXT> four 1-inch-thick, bone-in pork rib chops<INGR_NEXT> corn salad, for serving<INGR_END><INSTR_START> in a medium saucepan, heat the oil.<INSTR_NEXT> add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the garlic and chiles and cook, stirring, until well toasted and fragrant, 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add the broth and bring to a boil.<INSTR_NEXT> simmer the sauce over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chiles are softened, 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer the mixture to a blender, add the sugar and puree until smooth.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer the adobo sauce to a bowl.<INSTR_NEXT> season with salt and pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> light a grill and oil the grate.<INSTR_NEXT> season the chops with salt and pepper and rub with 3/4 cup of the adobo sauce.<INSTR_NEXT> grill over moderate heat, turning every 5 minutes and basting with the remaining 3/4 cup of sauce, until cooked through, 20 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer the chops to plates and let rest for 5 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> serve with corn salad.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces dried guajillo chiles, stemmed, seeded and cut into 2-inch pieces
output_sentences: In a medium saucepan, heat the oil.
Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and chiles and cook, stirring, until well toasted and fragrant, 2 minutes.
Add the broth and bring to a boil.
Simmer the sauce over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chiles are softened, 5 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a blender, add the sugar and puree until smooth.
Transfer the adobo sauce to a bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Light a grill and oil the grate.
Season the chops with salt and pepper and rub with 3/4 cup of the adobo sauce.
Grill over moderate heat, turning every 5 minutes and basting with the remaining 3/4 cup of sauce, until cooked through, 20 minutes.
Transfer the chops to plates and let rest for 5 minutes.
Serve with corn salad.
output: In a medium saucepan, heat the oil. Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 minutes. Add the garlic and chiles and cook, stirring, until well toasted and fragrant, 2 minutes. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Simmer the sauce over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chiles are softened, 5 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a blender, add the sugar and puree until smooth. Transfer the adobo sauce to a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Light a grill and oil the grate. Season the chops with salt and pepper and rub with 3/4 cup of the adobo sauce. Grill over moderate heat, turning every 5 minutes and basting with the remaining 3/4 cup of sauce, until cooked through, 20 minutes. Transfer the chops to plates and let rest for 5 minutes. Serve with corn salad.
output_sentences_v1: Light a grill and oil the grate.
Season the chops with salt and pepper and rub with 3/4 cup of the adobo sauce.
Grill over moderate heat, turning every 5 minutes and basting with the remaining 3/4 cup of sauce, until cooked through, 20 minutes.
Serve with corn salad.
Transfer the adobo sauce to a bowl.
Transfer the chops to plates and let rest for 5 minutes.
Add the broth and bring to a boil.
Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a blender, add the sugar and puree until smooth.

input: Oven Baked Sweet and Sour Chicken Skewers
ingredients: 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1 1/2 in chunks
12 pineapple, prepared and cut into 1in chunks
12 red bell pepper, cut into 1in pieces
12 green bell pepper, cut into 1in pieces
output_sentences: For the marinade, combine the cinnamon, cumin, pepper, olive oil, soy sauce and brown sugar.
Add the chicken pieces, stir well and leave on one side for 2-3 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375f skewer alternating pieces of chicken, pineapple, red and green pepper and onion onto the sticks and arrange them in a roasting tin.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, turning the skewers once, halfway through cooking.
Baste regularly with leftover marinade from the chicken.
For the sweet and sour dipping sauce, heat a wok with the sesame oil and stir fry the garlic and ginger for about 30 seconds.
Turn down the heat a tad, and add the soy sauce, vinegars, ketchup, pineapple juice, brown sugar, honey, chili sauce and seasoning.
Mix the cornstarch and water together and stir into the sauce while still on the heat.
Stir until thickened.
Serve warm with the chicken skewers.
output: For the marinade, combine the cinnamon, cumin, pepper, olive oil, soy sauce and brown sugar. Add the chicken pieces, stir well and leave on one side for 2-3 hours. Preheat the oven to 375f skewer alternating pieces of chicken, pineapple, red and green pepper and onion onto the sticks and arrange them in a roasting tin. Bake for 15-20 minutes, turning the skewers once, halfway through cooking. Baste regularly with leftover marinade from the chicken. For the sweet and sour dipping sauce, heat a wok with the sesame oil and stir fry the garlic and ginger for about 30 seconds. Turn down the heat a tad, and add the soy sauce, vinegars, ketchup, pineapple juice, brown sugar, honey, chili sauce and seasoning. Mix the cornstarch and water together and stir into the sauce while still on the heat. Stir until thickened. Serve warm with the chicken skewers.

text: <TITLE_START> Eggs Baked in Mushrooms<TITLE_END><INGR_START> 1 lb mixed fresh mushrooms<INGR_NEXT> 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil<INGR_NEXT> 12 cup chopped onion<INGR_NEXT> 2 garlic cloves, minced<INGR_NEXT> 1 cup diced seeded ripe tomatoes, with their juices<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley<INGR_NEXT> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil<INGR_NEXT> kosher salt<INGR_NEXT> freshly ground black pepper<INGR_NEXT> 4 large eggs<INGR_NEXT> 14 cup grated asiago cheese<INGR_NEXT> toasted bread<INGR_END><INSTR_START> preheat oven to 400; generously butter four 8-ounce ramekins or small gratin dishes ; set the dishes on a baking sheet.<INSTR_NEXT> wipe the mushrooms clean with a damp paper towel; remove and discard the stems of shiitake mushrooms, if using.<INSTR_NEXT> chop the mushrooms into 1/4-inch pieces; you should have about 7 cups.<INSTR_NEXT> heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add in the mushrooms and onion; saute until mushrooms are tender and lightly browned, about 5-8 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> stir in the garlic; cook/stir for 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add in the tomatoes and their juices, parsley, and basil; cook/stir until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture is evenly moistened, about 2 minutes.<INSTR_NEXT> add salt to taste and a grinding of pepper.<INSTR_NEXT> transfer the mushroom mixture to the prepared dishes.<INSTR_NEXT> with the back of a spoon, make an indentation in the center of the mushroom mixture in each dish; break the eggs one at a time into a cup and slip an egg into each dish; sprinkle with the cheese.<INSTR_NEXT> bake until the whites are set, about 8 minutes; serve at once with the toast.<INSTR_END>
ingredients: 1 cup diced seeded ripe tomatoes, with their juices
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
output_sentences: Preheat oven to 400; generously butter four 8-ounce ramekins or small gratin dishes ; set the dishes on a baking sheet.
Wipe the mushrooms clean with a damp paper towel; remove and discard the stems of shiitake mushrooms, if using.
Chop the mushrooms into 1/4-inch pieces; you should have about 7 cups.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add in the mushrooms and onion; saute until mushrooms are tender and lightly browned, about 5-8 minutes.
Stir in the garlic; cook/stir for 2 minutes.
Add in the tomatoes and their juices, parsley, and basil; cook/stir until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture is evenly moistened, about 2 minutes.
Add salt to taste and a grinding of pepper.
Transfer the mushroom mixture to the prepared dishes.
With the back of a spoon, make an indentation in the center of the mushroom mixture in each dish; break the eggs one at a time into a cup and slip an egg into each dish; sprinkle with the cheese.
Bake until the whites are set, about 8 minutes; serve at once with the toast.
output: Preheat oven to 400; generously butter four 8-ounce ramekins or small gratin dishes ; set the dishes on a baking sheet. Wipe the mushrooms clean with a damp paper towel; remove and discard the stems of shiitake mushrooms, if using. Chop the mushrooms into 1/4-inch pieces; you should have about 7 cups. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add in the mushrooms and onion; saute until mushrooms are tender and lightly browned, about 5-8 minutes. Stir in the garlic; cook/stir for 2 minutes. Add in the tomatoes and their juices, parsley, and basil; cook/stir until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture is evenly moistened, about 2 minutes. Add salt to taste and a grinding of pepper. Transfer the mushroom mixture to the prepared dishes. With the back of a spoon, make an indentation in the center of the mushroom mixture in each dish; break the eggs one at a time into a cup and slip an egg into each dish; sprinkle with the cheese. Bake until the whites are set, about 8 minutes; serve at once with the toast.

Preheat oven to 400; generously butter four 8-ounce ramekins or small gratin dishes ; set the dishes on a baking sheet.
